offers.title: Senior DevOps Engineer  - F/H
offers.description_raw:
Lieu : Vélizy-Villacoublay, France Construisons ensemble un avenir de confiance Thales est un leader mondial des hautes technologies spécialisé dans trois secteurs d'activité : Défense & Sécurité, Aéronautique & Spatial, et Cyber & Digital. Il développe des produits et solutions qui contribuent à un monde plus sûr, plus respectueux de l'environnement et plus inclusif. Le Groupe investit près de 4 milliards d'euros par an en Recherche & Développement, notamment dans des domaines clés de l'innovation tels que l'IA, la cybersécurité, le quantique, les technologies du cloud et la 6G. Thales compte près de 81 000 collaborateurs dans 68 pays. Nos engagements, vos avantages Une réussite portée par notre excellence technologique, votre expérience et notre ambition partagée Un package de rémunération attractif Un développement des compétences en continu : parcours de formation, académies et communautés internes Un environnement inclusif, bienveillant et respectant l'équilibre des collaborateurs Un engagement sociétal et environnemental reconnu Votre quotidien Rejoignez-nous sur le campus Vélizy qui héberge une grande diversité d'activités Thales, aéro, défense, civile,... A l'ouest de Paris, ce site offre un environnement de travail équipé des dernières innovations technologiques et propose des services permettant de concilier vie professionnelle et personnelle. En tant que DevOps Engineer chez Thales, vos principales missions seront : Construire et maintenir une infrastructure IA et data pour plus de 30 000 ingénieurs Thales, en utilisant des technologies de pointe (y compris les LLMs et l'IA agentic ). Définir et documenter les exigences non fonctionnelles (NFRs) pour les applications à déployer, en collaboration avec les équipes de développement et les architectes. Développer et maintenir des ressources d'infrastructure en tant que code (IaC) pour garantir des déploiements cohérents et reproductibles. Rédiger et mettre à jour les manuels de déploiement et d'exploitation, ainsi que les plans de test. Gérer et résoudre des questions techniques complexes ou des incidents remontés par les équipes de support. Assurer la maintenance, les opérations et le support complexe de l'infrastructure cloud (uniquement pendant les heures de bureau). Développer et optimiser les pipelines d'intégration continue (CI) et de déploiement continu (CD) pour garantir des livraisons rapides et efficaces. Collaborer avec les équipes de développement pour implémenter et exécuter des tests d'intégration. Participer activement aux différentes cérémonies Agile. Votre profil : De formation Ingénieur ou équivalent, vous disposez d'une expérience confirmée d'au moins 7 ans dans la gestion des environnements de développement, de tests, et d'industrialisation du déploiement de solutions numériques sur des clouds publics (en particulier sur Google Cloud Platform). Compétences techniques : Vous avez une expertise dans les outils d'automatisation comme Terraform, les conteneurs et les Helm charts. Vous maîtrisez les outils de développement (Jira, Artifactory, GitLab, GitLab CI). Vous avez des connaissances solides en scripting avec Bash, ainsi que des compétences en développement logiciel avec Python. Vous avez de l'expérience dans le Cloud (idéalement GCP), la conteneurisation (Kubernetes), et idéalement des technologies liées aux données (Apache Spark, Apache Airflow, BigQuery, etc.). Vous comprenez les composants réseau (VPC, Firewall, etc.), les protocoles réseau (HTTPS, SSH, SMTP, DNS), les services d'infrastructure (load balancing, stockage, IAM, etc.) et la gestion des secrets. Vous vous intéressez aux technologies d'IA, en particulier l'IA générative Autonome, dynamique et proactif(ve), vous souhaitez évoluer au sein d'équipes passionnées par l'intégration des nouvelles technologies aux services des métiers de nos clients. Les qualités requises pour réussir dans cette fonction sont votre rigueur et organisation, votre capacité à communiquer avec des interlocuteurs divers, votre adaptabilité et votre autonomie. Enfin, un environnement multiculturel vous attire et vous êtes à l'aise en anglais (niveau C1 minimum). Thales, entreprise Handi-Engagée, reconnait tous les talents. La diversité est notre meilleur atout. Postulez et rejoignez nous !

Chez Thales, nous sommes fiers de travailler ensemble pour imaginer des solutions innovantes qui contribuent à construire un avenir plus sûr, plus vert et plus inclusif. Un avenir de confiance. Mais ces technologies ne viennent pas de nulle part. L'intelligence humaine est le moteur derrière la technologie qui fait la renommée de Thales. Les projets que nous conduisons sont complexes et nos clients exigeants. Pour répondre aux besoins actuels et futurs de nos clients, nous maîtrisons plus d'une centaine de disciplines, de l'optique à la physique quantique, du traitement du signal à la connectivité et à l'intelligence artificielle. Rejoindre Thales, c'est repousser les limites de la technologie et la mettre au service du progrès et du développement durable de nos sociétés. C'est donc être au cœur d'une formidable aventure technique. Une attention portée à l'équilibre des collaborateurs au service de leur réussite. C'est pourquoi, notamment, nous nous efforçons de créer un environnement de travail accueillant et d'accorder la flexibilité nécessaire à l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle. Nous savons que cet équilibre est essentiel à votre épanouissement et à la réussite des projets que nous vous confierons. Des parcours professionnels riches. Chez Thales, nous jouons collectif. Ce qui signifie travailler en équipe, côtoyer des experts et donc apprendre et développer ses compétences en permanence tout en faisant bénéficier le Groupe de son savoir-faire. C'est aussi la possibilité d'évoluer, de changer de fonction ou d'activité, voire de pays.

offers.title: Training Support Engineer
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** *Airbus Commercial Aircraft* is looking for a *Flight Dynamics Engineer* (f/m) to join our *Flight Dynamics & Performance* based in *Toulouse, France*. You will be part of a team developing natural flight loop models and simulation environments. As part of the *Aircraft Digital Reference team*, you will be involved in validation data preparation aiming at securing Aircraft deliveries on time and Quality. *Your working environment:* Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities! *How we care for you:* * *Financial rewards:* Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan and stock purchase plan. * *Work / Life Balance:* Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, and a Staff council offering many activities. * *Wellbeing / Health:* Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). * *Depending on the site:* Health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * *Individual development:* Upskilling opportunities with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses and expert career paths. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges:* * *Analyze* system evolutions to ensure the consistency of integrated flight models. * *Prepare* and validate qualification test data (QVSD/RQTG) for pilot training simulators worldwide. * *Manage* technical interfaces with partner organizations and support regulatory certifications. * *Lead* activities autonomously while respecting delivery planning and commitments. * *Propose* process, methods, and tools improvements to increase operational efficiency. *Your boarding pass:* * *Master's degree* in Aeronautical Engineering or equivalent. * *Experience:* Min. 1 to 2 years in simulation platform development and validation. * *Technical expertise* in Flight Mechanics, Model Integration, and real-time environments. * *English* fluency is mandatory for international collaboration. Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. Take your career to a new level and apply online now! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Operations SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe F11 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Flight & Space Physics By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: ICT Infrastructure engineer
offers.description_raw:
To strengthen our internal IT team, we are looking for a colleague to take on the role of ICT Infrastructure Engineer and 2nd-line internal IT support. You will work full-time at our office in Ghent/Brussels, with occasional travel mainly within Flanders, Brussels, Wallonia, the Benelux, and Tunisia. You will independently manage IT infrastructure projects under the supervision of the IT Director. The goal of these projects is to make the ICT infrastructure and its systems more stable and efficient. You will also be responsible for the proactive maintenance of this ICT infrastructure. You will install the standard ICT infrastructure in all existing and new offices, as well as during mergers, acquisitions, relocations, or office integrations. You will analyze and deploy new ICT systems, including those mandated by Emeria France. As part of the IT support within the Emeria Belux group, you will be responsible for second-line internal support for ICT systems (serving around 750 people across 45 offices). Your main tasks will include providing technical assistance and helping to resolve user issues. Working under the supervision of the IT Director, you will serve as a direct point of contact for users and external IT service providers. You communicate effectively with these stakeholders to solve problems, assist with the deployment of new programs or solutions, and handle the necessary documentation and administration. In addition to the tasks listed above, you will also be responsible for the following: Deploying and installing standard/new IT technologies and solutions. Equipping and maintaining the standard IT infrastructure in data centers and offices. Proactive maintenance and monitoring. Cybersecurity support and follow-up. Following up on requests submitted via the ticketing system. Implementing changes in internal systems. Working closely with your ICT colleagues and the IT Director, who has final responsibility for your actions.

Technical Skills Inform colleagues about identified technical issues, required modifications, and necessary corrections Develop technical solutions and recommendations, and communicate them to colleagues Analyze technical problems encountered by colleagues Conduct preliminary analysis and escalate complex technical issues to specialists (e.g., studies, research, maintenance, etc.) Field: Information Technology and Telecommunications Behavioral Skills Planning and organization Stress resilience Communication Attention to detail Results-oriented mindset Autonomy Flexibility Bilingual in Dutch/French

Emeria regroupe, à travers l'Europe, des marques spécialisées dans la gestion de copropriétés et la gestion locative, l'achat et la vente, le property management, et propose une gamme de services immobiliers allant des états des lieux et diagnostics techniques au courtage en assurances, en passant par la sécurité, les travaux d'entretien des copropriétés ou encore la commercialisation d'immeubles.Emeria est n° 1 de la gestion de copropriétés, de la gestion locative et de la location de biens en Allemagne, en Belgique, en France et au Royaume-Uni, et n° 2 en Suisse. Également présent au Luxembourg, aux Pays-Bas et au Portugal, Emeria est aussi un des leaders européens du property management.

You will independently manage IT infrastructure projects under the supervision of the IT Director. The goal of these projects is to make the ICT infrastructure and its systems more stable and efficient. You will also be responsible for the proactive maintenance of this ICT infrastructure. You will install the standard ICT infrastructure in all existing and new offices, as well as during mergers, acquisitions, relocations, or office integrations. You will analyze and deploy new ICT systems, including those mandated by Emeria France. As part of the IT support within the Emeria Belux group, you will be responsible for second-line internal support for ICT systems (serving around 750 people across 45 offices). Your main tasks will include providing technical assistance and helping to resolve user issues. Working under the supervision of the IT Director, you will serve as a direct point of contact for users and external IT service providers. You communicate effectively with these stakeholders to solve problems, assist with the deployment of new programs or solutions, and handle the necessary documentation and administration. In addition to the tasks listed above, you will also be responsible for the following: Deploying and installing standard/new IT technologies and solutions. Equipping and maintaining the standard IT infrastructure in data centers and offices. Proactive maintenance and monitoring. Cybersecurity support and follow-up. Following up on requests submitted via the ticketing system. Implementing changes in internal systems. Working closely with your ICT colleagues and the IT Director, who has final responsibility for your actions.
offers.description_profil: Technical Skills Inform colleagues about identified technical issues, required modifications, and necessary corrections Develop technical solutions and recommendations, and communicate them to colleagues Analyze technical problems encountered by colleagues Conduct preliminary analysis and escalate complex technical issues to specialists (e.g., studies, research, maintenance, etc.) Field: Information Technology and Telecommunications Behavioral Skills Planning and organization Stress resilience Communication Attention to detail Results-oriented mindset Autonomy Flexibility Bilingual in Dutch/French

offers.title: Lab Test Means Engineer (f/h)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** Airbus Commercial Aircraft is looking for a *Lab Test Means Engineer (f/m)* to join our Avionics Software Team based in Toulouse, France. You will join the 'Avionics Software' department, within the 'Avionics and Simulation products' engineering domain. This organization is an in-house avionics equipment and simulators supplier. Engineers in this domain are responsible for the design, the development, the production and the support of critical embedded products (e.g. Flight Controls, Flight Warning, Communication, Maintenance equipment) for all Airbus aircrafts. This organization is also a Chamber of Reference on Software and Electronics thanks to accomplished and experienced teams. *Your working environment :* Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities ! *How we care for you :* * *Financial rewards :* Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * *Work / Life Balance :* Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * *Wellbeing / Health :* Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * *Individual development :* Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges : * Test means development : * Specify and define architecture of test means products (Test-rigs, Inputs/Outputs modules, Emulators & Analyzer, Systems simulations, Automatic testing framework, Tool abstraction libraries, communication protocols) according to Building Blocks & Product Line approaches, * Participate in tests means development and ensures virtuous project collaboration with suppliers. * Plan & conduct acceptance test means procedures and delivery to operational teams, * Ensure the "Entry Into Service" of test means, Support & MCO : * Ensure and provide proactive support to users all along the test means lifecycle, * Participate in administration of assets in the software integration laboratory (test means version upgrades, roadmap to OS migrations, licenses installation, cyber-security analysis, firewall configurations, safety procedure, environment ...) Transverses & improvement activities : * Capture lessons learnt & recommendations. * Propose initiative to improve user experience and efficiency of software verifications activities, * Implement valuable evolution of our test means Product Lines by introducing disruptive, emergent technologies and common standard (ED-247, FMI, VISA), * Participate in Risks & Opportunities management. *Your boarding pass : * * Specification, design and architecture of avionics integration test-bed * Programming languages: C, python, ASM * Analogue & digital signals * Data bus: Eth, AFDX, ARINC 429, CAN, MIL-STD-1553 * Protocols: TCP/IP, UDP, TFTP, A615A-Dataloading * Operating Systems administration: LINUX & Windows * Support and collaboration mindset (customers and suppliers) * Open mindset and good team working * Embedded V cycle development process * Advanced level of English and French Not a 100% match ? No worries ! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. Take your career to a new level and apply online now ! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Operations SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe F11 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Sub-system development By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: Handling Qualities Engineer (m/f)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** *Airbus Commercial Aircraft* is looking for an *Handling Qualities Engineer* to join our Aircraft Control Domain department based in *Toulouse, France.* All along the aircraft (A/C) life, Handling Qualities (HQ) team plays an integrator role between flight physics and systems/Engine/Landing Gear which can be summarized through 3 main activities: * A/C control surfaces sizing to ensure the A/C maneuverability and stability requirements, * Flight domain definition : definition of characteristic speeds, definition of angle of attack protection settings, setup of weight & CG diagrams, All these activities in strong relation with cockpit systems and with operational people (Flight Operations, Flight test), * Assessment of the A/C behavior in case of failure of A/C systems and assessment of the criticality of the event. Contributing to defining the procedure with Flight Ops, Flight Tests and system teams how to manage the failure. The Handling Qualities team supports the in service fleets by analyzing the in service events with strong collaboration with Customer Support and Product Safety organizations. As well, the team supports the A/C during the production phases prior to the final delivery to our customers. *Your working environment:* Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities! How we care for you: * *Financial rewards:* Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * *Work / Life Balance:* Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * *Wellbeing / Health:* Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * *Individual development:* Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges:* * Checking aircraft and actuator sizing for HQ needs, * Defining flight domain where aircraft safety, comfort and reliability is guaranteed (definition of characteristic speeds, setting of angle of attack, sideslip domains, and procedure in case of failure cases), * Analyzing the consequences of any system failure on aircraft Stability and Control, * Analyzing in-service events and system behavior during these events, * Preparing, performing and following up simulator tests and flight tests requests necessary to validate those studies. This role could involve some travel for business and as such you have to be able to travel accordingly. *Your boarding pass:* * Degree in aeronautical engineering / mechanical engineering (or equivalent) with some experience, * Flight Dynamics knowledge,Test and/or Flight Physics knowledge, * Knowledge in Control simulation tools : Matlab, Simulink, ... * Knowledge in Automatic control of system Control feedback loop is a plus, * Interest in digitalisation (data analytics) would be a plus (e.g. Python), * Aircraft systems knowledge would be a significant advantage, * Advanced level of English and French. Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. Take your career to a new level and apply online now! #LI-MJG This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Operations SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe F12 *Experience Level:* Entry Level *Job Family:* Vehicle Mission & Control By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. offers.title: #ET19 Flight Loads Engineer (F/M)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** At our Airbus Helicopters location in Marignane, we are looking for active support for our team in the Vibration, Loads & Acoustics (ETGV) department as a *Flight Loads Engin**eer (m/f/d) !* In your role as a *Flight Loads Engineer* (m/f/d) you will be in charge of determining the limit and fatigue loads by simulation or flight tests analysis, from pre-design up to certification and serial life support. In addition to development projects, you will contribute to Research activities and to the continuous improvement of our methods and tools. You will work within a *transnational team in a cross-functional environment* with interfaces to many other engineering departments such as airframe, dynamic systems, flight tests, or airworthiness. *Your tasks & responsibilities :* * Determination of external loads acting on the vehicle due to trim conditions, maneuvering flight or flight in gusty condition by analytical methods, flight mechanics simulation, or evaluation of measurement data. * Specification, support and evaluation of component, ground and flight test campaign. * Contribute to the vehicle optimization process. Providing overall vehicle loads, sensitivity studies and a component view for structural design. * Development of leading methods and competences in the areas of Loads & Aeroelastics along with the required methods and tools. * Support product certification and the evolution of requirements in that area. **Desired skills and qualifications** You have the following skills and experience: * Educated to a master's degree level (diploma/master) in aeronautical engineering or mechanical engineering (or equivalent) * Good knowledge of the principles of aerodynamics and flight dynamics. * Good knowledge of aeroelastics * Experience in analysis of test data. * Coding/scripting experience with Python * You have excellent communication skills and a brilliant team spirit * You are open minded, you have a welcome problem attitude and you bring curiosity * You enjoy a transverse and international environment * Fluent in English, German is desirable, French is a plus * We look forward to receiving your convincing application! * This position will require a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities. This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Helicopters SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe F12 *Experience Level:* Entry Level *Job Family:* Flight & Space Physics By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. offers.title: Ingénieur(e) de Service/Customer Support Engineer H/F Instruments de laboratoire
offers.description_raw:
En bref : Ingénieur(e) de Service/Customer Support Engineer H/F - CDI - Vitry-sur-Seine (94) - Qualification et maintenance d'instruments pharmaceutique La division Industrie et Ingénierie de notre bureau Adsearch Paris recherche pour son client, qui fournit des solutions complètes de découverte, de mesure et de test, ainsi que des services pharmaceutiques spécialisés, un Ingénieur de Service (H/F) sur Vitry-sur-Seine. VOS MISSIONS Vous serez en charge des missions suivantes : - Planifier votre activité en suivant les priorités et donner de la visibilité sur votre planning à votre hiérarchie et aux Gestionnaires Clients - Assurer la maintenance des instruments en application des recommandations constructeurs - Réaliser la qualification des instruments à la suite de l'expertise des besoins clients - Effectuer les diagnostics et dépanner les instruments multimarques

PROFIL Vous êtes issu d'une formation BAC + 2 à 5 en chimie, biologie, physique ou électronique, ou de formation équivalente et pouvez justifier d'une expérience en maintenance. Vous avez des connaissances techniques approfondies sur les équipements couramment utilisés dans les laboratoires (HPLC/GC, Centrifugeuses, Dissolution, Mesures de température & hygrométrie, Hottes PSM) et une expérience en environnement de laboratoire. Vous êtes autonome, bien organisé(e), rigoureux(euse) avec des qualités reconnues de communication et un bon esprit d'équipe. Vous avez un excellent relationnel client et un niveau d'anglais professionnel. offers.title: Aircraft Data and Connectivity System Designer M/F
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** Airbus Commercial Aircraft is looking for a *Data and communication system engineer (F/M)* to join our Connectivity and Data system department based in Toulouse, France. You will be part of a team developing systems to collect data onboard, process it and send it from aircraft to ground. As part of the system designer team, you will be involved in designing embedded systems, but also ground systems aiming at supplying high throughput transmission capabilities to allow. *Your working environment :* Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities! *How we care for you :* * *Financial rewards : *Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * *Work / Life Balance :* Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * *Wellbeing / Health :* Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * *Individual development :* Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges :* * Define and design systems fulfilling certification requirements but also taking advantage of latest technologies to reach a quick go to market * Collaborate with colleagues across Europe * Understand Customer needs and ensure compliance of the system with customer expectation *Your boarding pass :* * You have been recently graduated and have a good academic knowledge of physics behind telecommunications * You know the main drivers to design both hardware and software efficient solutions * You have a good knowledge of telecommunications systems (cellular, point to point, wired, satcom, WiFi, ...) * You are always curious to learn, enthusiastic to solve new challenges. Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. Take your career to a new level and apply online now! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Operations SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe F11 *Experience Level:* Entry Level *Job Family:* Computing&Comm and Info& Data Processing By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: ATR - Experimented Mass Properties Engineer
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** Come onboard with the ATR *Aircraft Performance & Mass Properties* team and become *Mass Properties Engineer *of our *Engineering *directorate in *Philippe**'s Team! *You will work with *7 *passionate colleagues to make a difference in a human size company with attractive advantages! *What will be your role?* * Define, implement and monitor mass properties management standards, tools and processes * Prepare status and outlook weight, center of gravity and inertia data for aircraft in development * Initial estimate of the impacts on weight and center of gravity of the modifications on aircraft * Ensure the follow-up and validation of the final analysis of the impacts on weight, center of gravity and inertia of the modifications on aircraft carried out by the subcontractor (ATA paint & routing) * Provide support to Chief Engineering and Program for decision making * Leading exchanges with Airbus and Leonardo partners for mass properties domain * Leading weight saving project (design and maturity review with partners and engineering center of competence) * Provide internal and external support on all matters relating to mass properties * Collaborate with various engineering centers of competence (documentation, cabin, system, load, structure, certification) as well as with the offices in relation with the customer (marketing, technical and operational support, delivery) in the quest for optimum mass * Preparation and execution of contractual weighing and creation of weight reports, loading plans and trim sheets * Preparation and follow-up of loading plans for test flights of production aircraft and ATR prototypes * Punctual interventions on the ATR production site will be necessary during the day as well as in the evening and on weekends, on call-duty, for contractual weighing (mainly in the last quarter or during periods of strong delivery activities). *What makes you a great fit?* * Field of study: Degree in Aeronautical Engineering * Experience: 5 to 15 years in Mass properties (Engineering) * Technical skills / knowledge * Weight, Center of gravity and Inertia assessment methods * Definition of weight limitations and certified center of gravity envelope * Definition of mechanical equilibrium of an aircraft on ground * General knowledge of aeronautical structure, systems and cabin * Microsoft® Office Package, especially Excel® and VBA® programming for macro realization * Knowledge of CATIA V5 or 3DEX or ARAS * Good knowledge of Airbus tools (IBM, EBAM, Airina...) * Soft skills * Good communication skills * Well and self organized with team spirit * Open minded and proactive to priority changes * Fluent in English and French (Italian is a plus) * ... but above all, you are ready to take off with us to keep connecting communities and businesses and provide the best possible products and support to our customers! Interested ? Then get your career off to a flighting start with ATR and join the *Aircraft Performance & Mass Properties* Team! Venez rejoindre l'équipe *Aircraft Performance & Mass Properties* d'ATR et devenez *Ingénieur* *Mass Properties *de notre direction *Engineering *au sein de l'équipe de *Philippe*! Vous travaillerez avec *7* collègues passionnés pour faire la différence dans une entreprise à taille humaine avec des avantages attractifs ! *Quel sera votre rôle ?* * Préparer les données de statut et de prévision du poids, du centre de gravité et de l'inertie pour les avions en développement * Estimation initiale des impacts sur le poids et le centre de gravité des modifications sur les avions * Assurer le suivi et la validation de l'analyse finale des impacts sur le poids, le centre de gravité et l'inertie des modifications sur les avions * Fournir un soutien au chef de l'ingénierie et au programme pour la prise de décision * Mener les échanges avec Airbus et Leonardo partenaires pour le domaine des propriétés de masse * Mener le projet de réduction de poids (revues de conception et de maturité avec les partenaires et les centres de compétences en ingénierie) * Fournir un soutien interne et externe sur toutes les questions relatives aux propriétés de masse * Collaborer avec les différents centres de compétences de la direction Engineering (documentation, cabine, système, charge, structure, certification) ainsi qu'avec les départements en relation avec le client (marketing, support technique et opérationnel, livraison) * Préparation et exécution de pesées contractuelles et création des rapports de poids, plans et feuilles de chargement * Préparation et suivi des plans de chargement pour les vols d'essai des avions de série produits et des prototypes ATR * Des interventions ponctuelles sur le site de production d'ATR seront nécessaires en journée, en soirée et le week-end, en astreinte, pour la pesée contractuelle (principalement au dernier trimestre ou lors des périodes de livraison intenses). *Qu'est-ce qui fait de vous un candidat idéal ?* * Domaine d'études : Diplôme en ingénierie aéronautique * Expérience : 5 à 15 ans dans le domaine des propriétés de masse (ingénierie) * Compétences techniques / connaissances * Définition des limitations de poids et enveloppe certifiée du centre de gravité * Définition de l'équilibre mécanique d'un avion au sol * Méthodes d'évaluation du poids, de l'équilibre et de l'inertie * Connaissances générales en structure, systèmes et cabine d'avions * Microsoft® Office Package, en particulier la programmation Excel® et VBA® pour la réalisation de macros * Connaissance de CATIA V5 ou 3DEX ou ARAS * Bonne connaissance des outils Airbus (IBM, EBAM, Airina...) * Compétences non techniques * Bonnes compétences en communication * Bien organisé et autoorganisé avec esprit d'équipe * Ouvert d'esprit et proactif face aux changements de priorités * Maîtrise de l'anglais et du français (l'italien est un plus) * ... mais surtout, vous êtes prêt à prendre votre envol avec nous pour continuer à connecter les communautés et les entreprises et à fournir les meilleurs produits ainsi que le meilleur soutien possible à nos clients ! Intéressé(e) ? Alors faite décoller votre carrière avec ATR et rejoignez l'équipe *Aircraft Performance & Mass Properties* ! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Avions de Transport Regional (ATR) GIE *Contract Type:* Permanent ----- Classe Emploi (France): Classe G14 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Flight & Space Physics By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: Senior Flight Operations Engineer M/F
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** *Airbus Commercial Aircraft* is looking for a *Senior Flight Operations Engineer * * (f/m)* to join our *Customer Services Departmen*t based in Toulouse, France. The Airbus Flight Operation Support and Training Standards (STL) department is composed of approximately 170 dedicated professionals in Europe, with additional staff globally. This team, which includes pilots, simulator instructors, flight operations engineers, performance engineers, and support directors, collaborates to deliver comprehensive operational support to our Operators. The STL department provides Airline Flight Operations with all the necessary data for the pilots and airline flight operation engineers to operate safely and efficiently Airbus aircraft. We are searching for a customer-centric Senior Flight Operation Engineer to join our Flight Operations & Training Support (STL) team. The role is primarily aimed at increasing A/C Operational Reliability, your efforts will directly contribute to maximizing airline customer satisfaction. You will leverage your extensive knowledge of airline flight operations to develop and implement solutions that enhance the A/C operational availability, safety, and economic efficiency of the Airbus fleet globally. This role demands a proactive approach to customer service, turning operational challenges into opportunities for technical and procedural improvement. This is an exciting and dynamic job opportunity to internally work together with pilots, simulator instructors, and flight operation engineers and in close coordination with several other Airbus departments such as Flight Tests, Flight Crew Training, Design Office, Safety, Aircraft Design and Support Programs, Human factor specialists, Engineering Support, Airtac, NavBlue, etc on all Airbus aircraft programs. *Your working environment:* Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities! *How we care for you:* * Financial rewards: Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * Work / Life Balance: Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * Wellbeing / Health: Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * Individual development: Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges:* Conducting Technical studies on a set of ATA systems (with regular system turnover), especially liaising with Engineering and Support domains : * Creating or modifying the Operational documentation for the use of pilots (FCOM, AFM, FCTM, MMEL/CDL, QRH) either for continuous improvement or new system embodiment, * Defining normal or abnormal procedures for the flight crew in coordination with other stakeholders, * Preparing supporting dossier to Airworthiness Authorities (EASA, FAA) under the supervision of a CVE/DAE to justify certified manual change (MMEL/AFM), * Studying MMEL dispatch conditions or deviations to permit the maximum flexibility for operators, * Assessing safety events and technical issues to propose flight crew recommendations and alternative procedures, * Using the configuration criterion of Airbus aircraft to deliver appropriate content to operators. Supporting Operators, liaising with Engineering support: * Answering operator queries on technical subjects about flight operations, * Planning and presenting technical subjects in web conferences, * Performing presentations on Flight Operation subjects in seminars., * Visiting airlines and performing observation flights to improve airline operations., * Taking part of on-call standby, out of working hours, to support the Support Center/Airtac in order to deliver operational assistance and approved deviations to the MMEL, * Providing NavBlue with operational expertise to develop flight operation services, * Participating in the development of new tools for flight operations continuous improvement. This role will involve some travels for business worldwide and as such you must be able to travel accordingly. *Your boarding pass:* * Educated to a 5-year degree level in aeronautics or equivalent, * Sound knowledge and understanding of aircraft systems (function, in service and architecture), or ability to quickly learn and understand (other) aircraft systems, * Versatile person with proven ability to work in changing environments under time pressure, * Capacity to organize and prioritize tasks in a team spirit working environment, * Communication skills (written, verbal) and customer-focused personality; experience is a plus * The knowledge of airline operations, or practical aviation experience, or flight operation experience is advantageous, * The knowledge of creation, application, and certification process of the Master Minimum Equipment List (MMEL) is advantageous. * Language Skills: English Negotiation Level. Take your career to a new level and apply online now! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** AIRBUS SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe G13 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Customer Flight/Mission & Ops Support By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities! *How we care for you:* * Financial rewards: Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * Work / Life Balance: Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * Wellbeing / Health: Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * Individual development: Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges:* Conducting Technical studies on a set of ATA systems (with regular system turnover), especially liaising with Engineering and Support domains : * Creating or modifying the Operational documentation for the use of pilots (FCOM, AFM, FCTM, MMEL/CDL, QRH) either for continuous improvement or new system embodiment, * Defining normal or abnormal procedures for the flight crew in coordination with other stakeholders, * Preparing supporting dossier to Airworthiness Authorities (EASA, FAA) under the supervision of a CVE/DAE to justify certified manual change (MMEL/AFM), * Studying MMEL dispatch conditions or deviations to permit the maximum flexibility for operators, * Assessing safety events and technical issues to propose flight crew recommendations and alternative procedures, * Using the configuration criterion of Airbus aircraft to deliver appropriate content to operators. Supporting Operators, liaising with Engineering support: * Answering operator queries on technical subjects about flight operations, * Planning and presenting technical subjects in web conferences, * Performing presentations on Flight Operation subjects in seminars., * Visiting airlines and performing observation flights to improve airline operations., * Taking part of on-call standby, out of working hours, to support the Support Center/Airtac in order to deliver operational assistance and approved deviations to the MMEL, * Providing NavBlue with operational expertise to develop flight operation services, * Participating in the development of new tools for flight operations continuous improvement. This role will involve some travels for business worldwide and as such you must be able to travel accordingly. *Your boarding pass:* * Educated to a 5-year degree level in aeronautics or equivalent, * Sound knowledge and understanding of aircraft systems (function, in service and architecture), or ability to quickly learn and understand (other) aircraft systems, * Versatile person with proven ability to work in changing environments under time pressure, * Capacity to organize and prioritize tasks in a team spirit working environment, * Communication skills (written, verbal) and customer-focused personality; experience is a plus * The knowledge of airline operations, or practical aviation experience, or flight operation experience is advantageous, * The knowledge of creation, application, and certification process of the Master Minimum Equipment List (MMEL) is advantageous. * Language Skills: English Negotiation Level. Take your career to a new level and apply online now! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** AIRBUS SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe G13 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Customer Flight/Mission & Ops Support By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: ATR - Fleet Structural Support Heavy Repair Engineer - Referent
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** * About us * ATR is the *world's number one aircraft manufacturer in regional aviation* providing a new generation of turboprops. We are a joint venture between *two European aeronautical heavyweights, Airbus and Leonardo.* From the world's largest cities to our planet's most remote regions*, our purpose is to deliver air travel* to people, communities and businesses in an *innovative, sustainable and modern way.* If you strive for excellence, are driven by *ambition*, *trust *and *respect* as we are, then get your career off to a flighting start with ATR! *Our leadership profile:* * People Centric Entrepreneurial Inspiring Exemplary Innovative Humble * * At ATR y **ou will work with passionate colleagues to make a difference in a human size company with attractive advantages! * We are looking for a *Fleet Structural Support Heavy Repair engineer * to come onboard in our *Structure Fleet Support Department* in *Benjamin*'s team: a team of *5 *collaborators! * Your Mission * * Carry out the design of structural repairs for complex issues requiring prompt resolution. Provide support for minor and major repairs required by clients on a longer-term support basis. * Investigate the existence of previous cases of damage and similar repairs to ensure consistent support. * Develop generic repair procedures to efficiently address recurring issues. * Customer and Stakeholder Liaison: use communication skills to effectively liaise with customers and internal stakeholders. Oversee the entire life cycle of global critical queries, from initial receipt to full resolution, ensuring transparency, accuracy, and customer satisfaction throughout the process. * Design Organization Engagement: Actively participate in Design Organization activities by preparing, approving (Airworthiness signature) and releasing critical approval documents (such as Technical Adaptation and Structural Repair Approval Sheets) under Part21J delegation. * Subcontractor Supervision: Manage the portfolio of subcontractors, ensuring clear work specifications/rules/criteria, expectations AND systematic monitoring of OTD/OQD. A strong technical background allows for thorough technical checks, ensuring high standards. * Lead and define scope (Inspection List) of on-site damage assessment missions to evaluate the structural integrity of in-service aircraft subjected to potentially severe damage scenarios (engine fire, hard landing, runway excursion, ground collision, etc.), approve and release associated report. * Ensure technical coordination and liaison between customers, ATR Part145 team and the structures engineering teams at ATR HQ's during troubleshooting missions, retrofits, major repairs and/or replacements carried out either by clients or by ATR Part 145 teams, as required. * Ensure strict adherence to existing procedures for the treatment of repairs related to ongoing/open Airworthiness Dossiers; provide feedback to dossier-owners for the incorporation of best practices, in a continuous improvement loop. * Provide technical advice to guide the choices to make for selection and introduction of repetitive repairs into the Structural Repair Manual * Validate Maintenance Procedures and participate to the vetting of Service Bulletins prepared by the Operability and Technical Data team. * About you * * *Field of study*: aeronautical structures or mechanical engineering * *Experience*: minimum 10 years of experience, with a minimum of 6 years in aircraft structure stress analysis or repair. Demonstrated expertise in complex structural repair and support, with a track record of successful problem-solving in high-pressure situations. * *Technical skills / knowledge:* * Proficiency in aircraft structures (preferably ATR structures). * Expertise in aircraft structural repair principles (both metallic and composite). * In-depth knowledge of metallic and composite materials. * Good knowledge of Part21J, Part21G, Part145 regulations and JAR/FAR/CS-25 * Familiarity with non-destructive testing methods. * Knowledge of Leonardo / Airbus drawings is a plus. * *Languages:* Fluent in English and French (Italian and other languages are a plus) * *IT skills:* * Proficient in Microsoft Office. * Familiarity with ATR IT tools (CRM, SAMONIT, GILDA) is advantageous. * *Soft skills:* * Autonomous and rigorous with strong organizational skills. * Open-minded, positive thinking, and an excellent team player. * Strong customer orientation, with the ability to understand and anticipate customer needs, and provide tailored solutions. * Demonstrated ability to train and mentor other engineers in the team * Capability to develop a productive network, to escalate issues and to provide technical advice to peers and hierarchy * Global vision and capacity to address technical issues in a holistic manner * Problem-solving and capacity to work under pressure * *Specific Constraints:* * The position will require participation in stand-by duties during evenings, nights, weekends and weekend nights, in order to ensure 24x7 support service * This position requires flexibility and readiness to travel abroad, sometimes within short notice, to participate to on-site support missions (damage assessments, working parties, troubleshooting, etc...) * ... but above all, you are ready to take off with us to keep connecting communities and businesses and provide the best possible products and support to our customers! * Our Recruitment Process * * *Benjamin* will contact you * Innovative and digital assessment * To get to know you better: interview with *Benjamin* then with our HR Recruiter * What we offer * *Highly competitive compensation package * (profit and success sharing, employee savings plan...) * Work-life balance * (remote working, 6th week of paid leave, additional days off for family events...) * Well-being / health * (supplementary health & welfare coverage...) * Career paths * enabling employees to develop their skills and build a professional project * Wide choice of development programs * for soft and hard skills * CSE: * ATR (family and employee events) and Airbus CSE (travel, vacation camps ...) *Diversity* *and inclusion*: Over 1200 men & women with more than 35 different nationalities work together in our teams! ATR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. _________________________________________________________________________ * A propos d'ATR * ATR est le *premier constructeur mondial d'avions régionaux* et propose une nouvelle génération de turbopropulseurs. Nous sommes une *filiale de deux poids lourds de l'aéronautique européenne, Airbus et Leonardo. * Des plus grandes villes du monde aux régions les plus reculées de notre planète, *notre objectif est d'assurer le transport aérien* des personnes, des communautés et des entreprises d'une manière innovante, durable et moderne. Si vous recherchez l'excellence, si vous êtes animé par *l'ambition,* la *confiance* et le *respect,* alors faites décoller votre carrière avec ATR *! * *Notre Leadership Profile : * *Centré(e) sur l'humain un esprit entrepreneur inspirant(e) exemplaire innovant(e) humble* *Vous travaillerez avec des collègues passionnés pour faire la différence dans une entreprise à taille humaine avec des avantages attractifs ! * Nous recherchons un *Ingénieur Support Flotte - Réparations Structurelles Complexes *pour rejoindre notre *Département Support Structure* au sein de l'équipe de *Benjamin* : une équipe de *5 *collaborateurs ! * Votre mission * * Réaliser la conception de réparations structurelles pour des problématiques complexes. Fournir un support pour les réparations mineures et majeures demandées par les clients dans le cadre de problématique long terme. * Rechercher l'existence de cas antérieurs de dommages et de réparations similaires afin d'assurer une assistance. * Développer des procédures de réparation génériques pour traiter efficacement les problèmes récurrents. * Relation Client et Parties Prenantes : Utiliser ses compétences en communication pour assurer une liaison efficace avec les clients et les parties prenantes internes. Superviser l'ensemble du cycle de vie des demandes, depuis la réception…

offers.title: Alternance Machine Learning Engineer - Lille (F/H)
offers.description_raw:
Comprendre et répondre aux enjeux du sujet, en synergie avec notre AI partenaire S'approprier la stack technique de l'entreprise Veille sur les solutions du marché Présenter et faire valider l'architecture technique proposée à l'équipe Implémenter la solution via du code python Fournir un code compréhensible, documenté, et en accord avec les standards de l'équipe et du marché Proposer une industrialisation du sujet

Maîtrise de Python et SQL, appuyée par un bon bagage mathématique (stats, probas). Vous dépassez le stade du notebook ; vous avez le souci du code propre, de l'architecture et de l'industrialisation (CI/CD, Docker). Capacité à prendre de la hauteur pour comprendre comment votre modèle s'intègre dans une stack complète (Cloud/GCP, API, Data pipelines). Curiosité marquée pour la GenAI (LLM, Agents), les bases de données modernes et le MLOps. Du bon sens et du pragmatisme pour analyser les résultats et proposer des solutions techniques viables en production.Poste basé à Lezennes (59260)

L'ISCOD, spécialiste de la formation en Digital Learning, recherche pour son entreprise partenaire, grande chaine de magasins spécialisée dans le bricolage, un(e) Machine Learning Engineer en contrat d'apprentissage, pour préparer l'une de nos formations diplômantes reconnues par l'Etat de niveau 5 à niveau 7 (Bac+2, Bachelor/Bac+3 ou Mastère/Bac+5). Choisissez l'alternance nouvelle génération avec l'ISCOD !

offers.title: AI Lead Engineer – Editeur de logiciel dans le retail
offers.description_raw:
L'équipe Data est aujourd'hui composée de 2 Data Engineers plutôt juniors . L'objectif est de renforcer cette équipe avec un profil senior, capable de faire avancer les sujets IA dans la durée. Vous intervenez comme référent IA opérationnel , avec une forte dimension développement. Vos responsabilités : Développer en Python des solutions IA réellement utilisées et mises en production Concevoir et déployer des cas d'usage IA / GenAI (IA classique ou LLM) Structurer les développements avec une logique d'architecture logicielle (sans être architecte pur) Travailler sur des sujets IA en continu, là où les équipes manquent de temps Les sujets IA s'articulent autour de 4 grands axes : Intégration de l'IA dans le produit pour accélérer la création de catalogues Sujets créatifs : génération et manipulation d'images promotionnelles Optimisation des processus : chatbots, RAG, gestion des connaissances Acculturation à l'IA , accompagnement et formation des équipes internes Environnement technique : Python, LLM, RAG, embeddings, agents, Pandas, PySpark, MinIO, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, Airflow, RabbitMQ Pourquoi rejoindre cette entreprise ? Un rôle clé dans la stratégie IA d'un éditeur SaaS leader Des cas d'usage concrets , en production, avec de la volumétrie réelle Un poste mêlant expertise technique, vision produit et impact…

8 ans d'expérience sont attendues au minimum en développement Python Vous avez de l'expérience sur des projets IA en production

La société pour laquelle nous recrutons est éditrice d'un solution multicanale spécialisée dans le développement et la commercialisation de prospectus et catalogues pour des clients du retail (Auchan, Leclerc, Metro …) Créée en 1990, l'entreprise est par la suite rachetée en 2013 par un grand groupe dans la communication et compte aujourd'hui 350 collaborateurs, pour 45M d'euros de chiffres d'affaires. L'entreprise est engagée dans une accélération forte de ses usages Data & IA , au cœur de ses produits et de sa proposition de valeur. Dans un contexte de transformation vers le SaaS , l'entreprise crée un poste stratégique de AI Lead Engineer , avec une attente claire : produire, structurer et mettre en production des solutions IA concrètes .

offers.title: Analytics Engineer Consultant - Luxe, Retail, Hospitalité, Services - CDI - Digital Customer
offers.description_raw: En tant qu'organisateur de forums de recrutement, Talents Handicap accompagne de très nombreuses entreprises & organisations en France dans leurs recrutements de collaborateurs en situation de handicap. Participant actuellement à l'un de nos forums. L'entreprise Wavestone recherche actuellement des profils : Description de l'entreprise Rejoignez un cabinet de conseil international qui accompagne les grandes transformations stratégiques. Nous sommes Wavestone : des expert·es passionné·es et orienté·es solutions, qui placent l'humain au cœur de la performance et de la croissance. Ambitieux·ses et en pleine expansion, nous développons sans cesse notre portefeuille de clients et de projets, avec une portée internationale et une réelle volonté de générer un impact positif. Êtes-vous un vrai team player, porté par des valeurs fortes ? Êtes-vous curieux·se et déterminé·e, avec l'envie d'apprendre chaque jour ? Êtes-vous du genre à relever les défis sans hésiter ? Alors vous êtes au bon endroit. Rejoignez Wavestone et exprimez votre potentiel dans un environnement stimulant et collaboratif, où l'on transforme les défis d'aujourd'hui en opportunités de demain. Description du poste Au sein du bureau de Paris, la business unit Digital Customer (350 collaborateurs) accompagne les grandes entreprises françaises et internationales dans leurs projets de transformation. La BU accompagne en particulier les secteurs du Luxe, du Retail, de la Beauté, de l'Hospitalité, des Services et des FMCG. Au cœur des plus grands enjeux actuels et futurs de ces secteurs, vous accompagnerez nos clients dans leurs projets de transformation les plus importants : lancement de nouvelles offres et de produits, digitalisation des parcours et processus métier, amélioration de la connaissance client, performance de la Supply Chain, exploitation des données pour la recherche et l'innovation, refonte des modèles de distribution… Au sein de la BU DC, l'offre Data, Analytics & AI (80 consultants au sein de la communauté) accompagne les directions métiers, Data & IT dans leurs transformations liées aux données. Les enjeux sont vastes : le renforcement de la connaissance client pour mieux cibler les actions Marketing, l'automatisation de processus via l'IA, la monétisation des données en sont des exemples. Nos équipes vont intervenir de bout en bout sur ces projets de transformation, de la stratégie à la mise en œuvre opérationnelle. Nous recherchons des Analytics Engineers capables d'intervenir tout au long de la chaîne de valeur data, de la réflexion stratégique à la mise en œuvre opérationnelle . Vous accompagnerez nos clients dans la structuration de leurs usages data, la définition d'indicateurs de performance pertinents et le déploiement de solutions analytiques robustes. Vous évoluerez sur des environnements data modernes en vous appuyant sur SQL et Power BI (indispensable) , avec, selon les missions, GCP BigQuery, Databricks ou Snowflake . La maîtrise de dbt et/ou d'autres outils de dataviz ( Tableau, Looker… ) constituera un véritable atout. Case n°1 : Grand acteur mondial du Luxe Dans un contexte de transformation majeure du SI , accompagnement du groupe dans la refonte complète des usages Analytics pour les périmètres Retail et Finance . Cadrage des besoins métiers et définition des indicateurs de pilotage clés pour les directions Retail et Finance Modélisation des données en vue d'une mise à disposition en self-service analytics pour les équipes métiers Spécification, conception et pilotage des transformations des données brutes dans dbt (modèles, règles de gestion, tests de qualité) Contribution à la gouvernance data et à la structuration des usages Analytics Pilotage et delivery des nouveaux dashboards de performance et de pilotage de l'entreprise ( Power BI ) Case n°2 : Grand acteur international des Cosmétiques Accompagnement dans la refonte de la méthodologie d'audit des usines de production , avec un fort enjeu de fiabilisation et de pilotage global. Cadrage du projet et formalisation des besoins des équipes Qualité, Industrielles et Corporate Conception d'un dashboard automatisé couvrant la collecte, la transformation et la visualisation des données d'audit Mise en place de vues analytiques à différents niveaux de granularité (zone géographique, site, usine) Transformation et structuration des données dans GCP / BigQuery Définition de la gouvernance data , des rôles et des rituels de pilotage associés Construction du cockpit de pilotage pour le suivi des audits et la prise de décision Case n°3 : Grand acteur FMCG Mise en place des dispositifs de pilotage data du plan stratégique visant à améliorer les compositions nutritionnelles des produits du groupe. Cadrage des nouveaux dashboards de pilotage : définition des KPI, parcours utilisateurs et UX Design Préparation et transformation des données dans Databricks Delivery des dashboards de pilotage dans Power BI à destination des équipes Corporate et Métiers Structuration des indicateurs de suivi de la performance nutritionnelle à différentes échelles (produit, gamme, portefeuille) Cadrage de cas d'usage d'Advanced Analytics pour faciliter les simulations (composition produit, tendances d'évolution...) Qualifications Issu(e) d'une école d'ingénieur (généraliste ou SI/Data) ou d'une école de commerce avec une majeure Data & Analytics , vous êtes un profil hybride , à l'aise avec les sujets techniques tout en conservant une forte sensibilité business. Vous aimez comprendre les enjeux métiers, challenger l'existant et traduire les besoins des directions Client, Marketing, Supply Chain, Recherche & Innovation, Retail & Distribution ou Commerciale en solutions data concrètes. Curieux(se), adaptable et orienté(e) impact, vous appréciez les contextes de conseil , où vous pouvez intervenir aussi bien en amont sur la vision et la stratégie data qu'au quotidien sur l' exécution et l'adoption des solutions . Vous souhaitez en particulier monter en compétences sur les aspects technologiques liées à la donnée (préparation, transformation, BI, advanced analytics, data science…). Votre curiosité intellectuelle, vous permet de comprendre rapidement les spécificités de nos clients. Vous êtes doté.e d'un esprit critique et analytique aiguisé, d'un très bon relationnel et d'un sens prononcé du service et de l'excellence. Vous souhaitez intégrer des équipes favorisant la proximité et la transmission des savoirs. Vous recherchez un environnement de travail stimulant, propice à l'épanouissement personnel au sein d'un cabinet de conseil reconnu et en pleine croissance. Si votre objectif est d'être acteur d'un projet d'entreprise ambitieux et de mettre à profit votre talent et votre enthousiasme dans une société qui saura vous proposer une trajectoire dynamique et des prises de responsabilités rapide, donnez-vous les chances de rejoindre nos équipes ! Informations supplémentaires Wavestone est un employeur inclusif qui s'engage pour l'égalité des chances. Dans le cadre de cette politique de diversité et inclusion, Wavestone accompagne les personnes en situation de handicap et/ou nécessitant un aménagement durant leur process de recrutement et tout au long de leur prise de poste.
offers.description_poste: En tant qu'organisateur de forums de recrutement, Talents Handicap accompagne de très nombreuses entreprises & organisations en France dans leurs recrutements de collaborateurs en situation de handicap. Participant actuellement à l'un de nos forums. L'entreprise Wavestone recherche actuellement des profils : Description de l'entreprise Rejoignez un cabinet de conseil international qui accompagne les grandes transformations stratégiques. Nous sommes Wavestone : des expert·es passionné·es et orienté·es solutions, qui placent l'humain au cœur de la performance et de la croissance. Ambitieux·ses et en pleine expansion, nous développons sans cesse notre portefeuille de clients et de projets, avec une portée internationale et une réelle volonté de générer un impact positif. Êtes-vous un vrai team player, porté par des valeurs fortes ? Êtes-vous curieux·se et déterminé·e, avec l'envie d'apprendre chaque jour ? Êtes-vous du genre à relever les défis sans hésiter ? Alors vous êtes au bon endroit. Rejoignez Wavestone et exprimez votre potentiel dans un environnement stimulant et collaboratif, où l'on transforme les défis d'aujourd'hui en opportunités de demain. Description du poste Au sein du bureau de Paris, la business unit Digital Customer (350 collaborateurs) accompagne les grandes entreprises françaises et internationales dans leurs projets de transformation. La BU accompagne en particulier les secteurs du Luxe, du Retail, de la Beauté, de l'Hospitalité, des Services et des FMCG. Au cœur des plus grands enjeux actuels et futurs de ces secteurs, vous accompagnerez nos clients dans leurs projets de transformation les plus importants : lancement de nouvelles offres et de produits, digitalisation des parcours et processus métier, amélioration de la connaissance client, performance de la Supply Chain, exploitation des données pour la recherche et l'innovation, refonte des modèles de distribution… Au sein de la BU DC, l'offre Data, Analytics & AI (80 consultants au sein de la communauté) accompagne les directions métiers, Data & IT dans leurs transformations liées aux données. Les enjeux sont vastes : le renforcement de la connaissance client pour mieux cibler les actions Marketing, l'automatisation de processus via l'IA, la monétisation des données en sont des exemples. Nos équipes vont intervenir de bout en bout sur ces projets de transformation, de la stratégie à la mise en œuvre opérationnelle. Nous recherchons des Analytics Engineers capables d'intervenir tout au long de la chaîne de valeur data, de la réflexion stratégique à la mise en œuvre opérationnelle . Vous accompagnerez nos clients dans la structuration de leurs usages data, la définition d'indicateurs de performance pertinents et le déploiement de solutions analytiques robustes. Vous évoluerez sur des environnements data modernes en vous appuyant sur SQL et Power BI (indispensable) , avec, selon les missions, GCP BigQuery, Databricks ou Snowflake . La maîtrise de dbt et/ou d'autres outils de dataviz ( Tableau, Looker… ) constituera un véritable atout. Case n°1 : Grand acteur mondial du Luxe Dans un contexte de transformation majeure du SI , accompagnement du groupe dans la refonte complète des usages Analytics pour les périmètres Retail et Finance .
