offers.title: Ingénieur IA H/F
offers.description_raw:
Contexte Plus que pro développe une nouvelle génération d'assistants virtuels basés sur l'IA, destinés à accompagner les professionnels de TPE/PME dans leurs activités quotidiennes. Ces assistants ne sont pas de simples chatbots. Ce sont des systèmes IA orientés action, capables de : Comprendre le contexte métier spécifique de chaque client Répondre à des questions de manière fiable et contextualisée Exécuter des actions réelles telles que la sollicitation d'avis clients, le recouvrement de factures, la planification de rendez-vous ou l'interaction avec des outils internes Notre plateforme combine : Des LLM (Large Language Models) pour l'interaction en langage naturel (texte et voix) Des graphes de connaissance pour représenter les données métier nombreuses et hétérogènes de façon structurée et exploitable Des systèmes de données robustes garantissant exactitude, fraîcheur, sécurité et traçabilité Dans le cadre de notre feuille de route 2026, l'intelligence artificielle et le machine learning deviennent des piliers stratégiques. Nous recherchons un Ingénieur IA avec une forte expertise en LLM, agents IA et systèmes ML en production pour renforcer l'équipe IA/Data avec la mission de concevoir, entraîner et déployer des modèles d'IA de pointe, ainsi que de développer des architectures d'agents intelligents capables d'agir de manière autonome. Votre mission Vous serez responsable de la conception, du développement et de l'optimisation des composants IA/ML de notre plateforme d'assistants virtuels. Votre travail permettra à nos systèmes IA de : Développer des agents IA autonomes capables de planifier et d'exécuter des workflows multi-étapes Orchestrer des workflows complexes à travers des agents IA multi-étapes Intégrer les modèles state-of-the-art et les adapter aux besoins spécifiques de nos clients Concevoir des architectures hybrides (RAG + fine-tuning + agents + graphes de connaissance + Speech-To-Text + Text-To-Speech) Exécuter des actions métier de manière intelligente, fiable et traçable Prototyper et valider rapidement de nouvelles approches techniques Vous transformerez des modèles de recherche en systèmes IA robustes en production, en veillant à leur performance, leur scalabilité et leur maintenabilité. Vous serez au cœur de l'innovation technique de l'entreprise, en évaluant et intégrant continuellement les avancées de l'état de l'art en IA.

Expérience requise 5 ans ou plus d'expérience en tant qu'Ingénieur IA, Machine Learning Engineer, AI Research Engineer ou Data Scientist avec une forte composante IA en production Excellente maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques ML/DL/GenAI Expérience prouvée avec les LLM : fine-tuning, prompting avancé, architectures RAG, agents IA, MCP, LLMOps Solides connaissances en statistiques et en méthodes d'évaluation de modèles Expérience avec des environnements cloud (Azure) et la mise en production Connaissance des architectures de données pour l'IA (data lakes, feature stores, vector databases) Compréhension des environnements Linux et des déploiements dans des environnements cloud (Docker, Kubernetes) Maîtrise avancée de Git et des méthodes de CI/CD Capacité à interagir au quotidien avec les profils Data/Backend en comprenant les enjeux d'intégration système Atouts appréciés Expérience avec les graphes de connaissance pour l'IA (Neo4j) Expérience avec des frameworks d'agents (LangChain, LlamaIndex, AutoGPT, CrewAI) Connaissance des protocoles MCP (Model Context Protocol) Expérience en optimisation de modèles (quantization, distillation, pruning) Connaissance des bases de données vectorielles (Qdrant) Expérience avec Databricks Expérience en NLP avancé (NER, classification, summarization, question-answering) Connaissance des architectures multimodales (vision-language models) Expérience en environnement SaaS ou multi-tenant Votre environnement de travail Collaboration étroite avec les ingénieurs Data, les développeurs Backend et les équipes produit Forte autonomie et responsabilité technique sur les choix d'architecture IA Accent mis sur l'innovation contrôlée : équilibre entre recherche, rapidité d'implémentation et robustesse en production Culture d'apprentissage continu et de veille technologique Environnement où l'état de l'art en IA est une priorité stratégique

Devenez acteur du changement et rejoignez un Leader sur son marché : Protégez les consommateurs, Valorisez le savoir-faire des TPME Françaises ! Construisons ensemble un monde plus sûr pour les Consommateurs et plus valorisant pour les Entrepreneurs. Découvrez un secteur en pleine expansion et vivez avec nous une histoire pleine de succès !

offers.title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Data en alternance
offers.description_raw: En tant qu'organisateur de forums de recrutement, Talents Handicap accompagne de très nombreuses entreprises & organisations en France dans leurs recrutements de collaborateurs en situation de handicap. Participant actuellement à l'un de nos forums. L'entreprise Capgemini recherche actuellement des profils : Vos missions : Dans le cadre de votre alternance, vous ferez partie intégrante de l'équipe recrutement d'Insight & Data, l'entité spécialisée sur la Data et vos missions s'adapteront en fonction de votre montée en compétences . Vous serez amené(e) à recruter des profils Data (Data Engineer BI ou Big Data, Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Consultant SAP Data migration, MDG ou Reporting Analytics, Chefs de projets Data, Architectes…) Vous interviendrez sur les missions suivantes : Identification des besoins en recrutement Rédaction et diffusion d'annonces, sourcing et approche de candidats (site d'emploi, LinkedIn, …) Pré qualifications téléphoniques et participation à des entretiens avec les recruteurs seniors Rédaction de comptes-rendus Envoi des propositions d'embauche et des contrats et suivi de l'intégration des nouveaux collaborateurs Reporting de l'activité Vous pourrez également : Participer à des évènements et à des forums recrutement Communiquer sur les réseaux sociaux Être force de proposition

offers.title: Machine Learning Operations H/F
offers.description_raw:
AU QUOTIDIEN CA DONNE QUOI ? La Banque Commerciale en France (BCEF) accélère fortement la transformation digitale et l'usage de l'IA au service de ses clients et collaborateurs. Au sein de BCEF, l'IA Factory, intégrée à la DSI, a pour mission de déployer à l'échelle industrielle les solutions d'intelligence artificielle qui génèrent de la valeur métier, optimisent l'efficacité opérationnelle et améliorent l'expérience client. En tant que Machine Learning Operations (ML Ops), Vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans la mise à l'échelle, la performance et la robustesse des modèles d'intelligence artificielle déployés par l'IA Factory. Vous interviendrez essentiellement en phase de production, où vous assurerez la surveillance opérationnelle des modèles industrialisés par les ML Engineers, en garantissant leur stabilité, leur performance et la gestion des éventuels incidents. Vous contribuerez à une amélioration continue des pipelines IA afin d'offrir un service fiable, sécurisé et performant. Vos principales missions : Vous surveillerez en production les modèles fournis par plusieurs entités internes (ITG, CIB), analyserez les métriques et piloterez les alertes Vous mettrez en œuvre et optimiserez les pipelines CI/CD en lien avec l'écosystème technique : GitLab CI, DVC, MLflow, Docker, PostgreSQL… Vous administrerez et optimiserez l'usage de la plateforme Domino, notamment la gestion des organisations, des projets, des environnements et des ressources de calcul (FinOps) Vous contribuerez au développement d'intégrations entre Domino et les outils d'industrialisation Vous veillerez à la cohérence et la reproductibilité des environnements pour les modèles IA en production Vous collaborerez étroitement avec les équipes Data Science, ML Engineering et OPS pour garantir une industrialisation fluide, agile et sécurisée Vous rejoindrez une squad composée d'une vingtaine d'équipiers (Product Owner, IT Owner, ML Engineers, Data Scientists, ML Ops) situés entre Nantes et Montreuil. L'équipe travaille en mode Agile, au travers de rituels structurants qui facilitent l'intégration, la collaboration et la montée en compétence. Sur le site de Nantes, vous bénéficierez d'un environnement de travail privilégié : implantation en cœur de ville, à proximité du centre historique et de la gare, avec de nombreux services facilitant le quotidien (tickets restaurant, service médical, agence bancaire dédiée, solutions de stationnement durable…). ET APRES ? Ce poste vous offre une trajectoire d'évolution solide et valorisante au sein de la DSI BCEF et de l'écosystème Data & IA du Groupe. Vous développerez une expertise approfondie sur les plateformes d'industrialisation IA, la gestion de pipelines ML, la surveillance opérationnelle et l'automatisation. Après quelques années, vous pourrez évoluer vers des postes à forte expertise ou leadership tels que ML Ops Lead, ML Engineer Lead ou Data Scientist confirmé. Votre rôle constitue une étape clé pour accompagner la maturité IA du Groupe, avec une forte visibilité auprès des équipes techniques et métiers. LES AVANTAGES A NOUS REJOINDRE Un package rémunération et des avantages : Une rémunération annuelle fixe, versée sur 12 mois, comprise entre 44K € et 48K € brut, ajustée selon votre profil et votre expérience. S'ajouterait à ce montant une rémunération annuelle variable individuelle, entre 1 500 € et 2 000 € brut, liée à l'atteinte d'objectifs individuels et collectifs, et fonction des résultats et de la rentabilité de l'entreprise ; elle sera versée annuellement et au prorata du temps de travail et de présence. Accords d'entreprise et de groupe, plan épargne entreprise/retraite, intéressement et participation, accès au restaurant d'entreprise et /ou tickets restaurant, couverture santé et prévoyance, activités sociales et culturelles via le comité social et économique, … De la flexibilité avec un rythme de travail hybride : jusqu'à 2,5 jours de télétravail à définir avec votre manager Rejoignez un Groupe engagé et prenez part à notre grand projet de transformation vers la construction d'un monde plus durable. Découvrez nos engagements pour notre clientèle et la société. Engagez-vous à nos côtés sur votre temps professionnel, à travers notre programme OneMillionHoursToHelp. ÊTES-VOUS NOTRE PROCHAIN OU PROCHAINE MACHINE LEARNING OPERATIONS ? Vous êtes titulaire d'une formation supérieure (BAC+4/5) en Informatique et/ou en spécialisation Datascience/Machine Learning Vous disposez d'au moins 3 ans expérience préalable en Data Science ou en Machine Learning engineering ou en tant que ML Ops Vous avez une maîtrise solide de Python Vous possédez une bonne compréhension des méthodologies DevOps / MLOps, et d'une une expérience CI/CD (Ansible, Jenkins, GitLab CI), conteneurisation (Docker, Kubernetes) et outils de suivi de modèles (MLFlow, Kubeflow). Vous avez des connaissances ou une forte appétence pour la plateforme Domino Vous avez une forte capacité à évoluer dans un environnement exigeant et orienté production Vous disposez d'une culture data et d'une compréhension des enjeux d'industrialisation des modèles. Vous vous reconnaissez à travers les compétences comportementales suivantes : Adaptabilité Rigueur Collaboration active Esprit d'analyse Esprit de synthèse LES PROCHAINES ÉTAPES : Notre processus de recrutement se déroule en plusieurs étapes structurées pour vous offrir une expérience transparente et sereine : - Une évaluation technique menée par un expert de l'équipe. - Un entretien avec le manager, souvent en binôme, pour échanger sur le rôle, l'équipe et les attentes. - Un entretien RH, destiné à valider votre adéquation avec les valeurs du Groupe ainsi que votre projet professionnel. Chaque étape est conçue pour vous permettre de mieux comprendre l'environnement et de poser toutes vos questions. Chez BNP Paribas, ce sont vos compétences qui font la différence, pas votre handicap ! Envoyez votre CV à l'Équipe Recrutement Mission Handicap : *** L'éthique, au cœur de notre recrutement Nous veillons à ce que chaque candidat agisse avec intégrité. Les informations fournies (CV, identité, antécédents) peuvent être vérifiées à tout moment du processus. Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs et collaboratrices agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle. À tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos données d'identification et vos antécédents pourront être vérifiés.

BNP Paribas (BNPP) est une banque commerciale française présente dans 63 pays. Le groupe est issu de la fusion en avril 2000 entre la Banque nationale de Paris, banque née en 1965 de la fusion de l'ancienne banque nationale de crédit et du comptoir national d'escompte de Paris, et de la banque Paribas, établissement né au cours du xixe siècle. Avec 184 000 employés en avril 2023, la banque est organisée selon trois grands domaines d'activités : services bancaires pour particuliers et pour commerçants, services d'investissement et de protection, services bancaires pour entreprises et institutions.
offers.description_poste: AU QUOTIDIEN CA DONNE QUOI ? La Banque Commerciale en France (BCEF) accélère fortement la transformation digitale et l'usage de l'IA au service de ses clients et collaborateurs. Au sein de BCEF, l'IA Factory, intégrée à la DSI, a pour mission de déployer à l'échelle industrielle les solutions d'intelligence artificielle qui génèrent de la valeur métier, optimisent l'efficacité opérationnelle et améliorent l'expérience client. En tant que Machine Learning Operations (ML Ops), Vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans la mise à l'échelle, la performance et la robustesse des modèles d'intelligence artificielle déployés par l'IA Factory. Vous interviendrez essentiellement en phase de production, où vous assurerez la surveillance opérationnelle des modèles industrialisés par les ML Engineers, en garantissant leur stabilité, leur performance et la gestion des éventuels incidents. Vous contribuerez à une amélioration continue des pipelines IA afin d'offrir un service fiable, sécurisé et performant. Vos principales missions : Vous surveillerez en production les modèles fournis par plusieurs entités internes (ITG, CIB), analyserez les métriques et piloterez les alertes Vous mettrez en œuvre et optimiserez les pipelines CI/CD en lien avec l'écosystème technique : GitLab CI, DVC, MLflow, Docker, PostgreSQL… Vous administrerez et optimiserez l'usage de la plateforme Domino, notamment la gestion des organisations, des projets, des environnements et des ressources de calcul (FinOps) Vous contribuerez au développement d'intégrations entre Domino et les outils d'industrialisation Vous veillerez à la cohérence et la reproductibilité des environnements pour les modèles IA en production Vous collaborerez étroitement avec les équipes Data Science, ML Engineering et OPS pour garantir une industrialisation fluide, agile et sécurisée Vous rejoindrez une squad composée d'une vingtaine d'équipiers (Product Owner, IT Owner, ML Engineers, Data Scientists, ML Ops) situés entre Nantes et Montreuil. L'équipe travaille en mode Agile, au travers de rituels structurants qui facilitent l'intégration, la collaboration et la montée en compétence. Sur le site de Nantes, vous bénéficierez d'un environnement de travail privilégié : implantation en cœur de ville, à proximité du centre historique et de la gare, avec de nombreux services facilitant le quotidien (tickets restaurant, service médical, agence bancaire dédiée, solutions de stationnement durable…). ET APRES ? Ce poste vous offre une trajectoire d'évolution solide et valorisante au sein de la DSI BCEF et de l'écosystème Data & IA du Groupe. Vous développerez une expertise approfondie sur les plateformes d'industrialisation IA, la gestion de pipelines ML, la surveillance opérationnelle et l'automatisation. Après quelques années, vous pourrez évoluer vers des postes à forte expertise ou leadership tels que ML Ops Lead, ML Engineer Lead ou Data Scientist confirmé. Votre rôle constitue une étape clé pour accompagner la maturité IA du Groupe, avec une forte visibilité auprès des équipes techniques et métiers. LES AVANTAGES A NOUS REJOINDRE Un package rémunération et des avantages : Une rémunération annuelle fixe, versée sur 12 mois, comprise entre 44K € et 48K € brut, ajustée selon votre profil et votre expérience. S'ajouterait à ce montant une rémunération annuelle variable individuelle, entre 1 500 € et 2 000 € brut, liée à l'atteinte d'objectifs individuels et collectifs, et fonction des résultats et de la rentabilité de l'entreprise ; elle sera versée annuellement et au prorata du temps de travail et de présence. Accords d'entreprise et de groupe, plan épargne entreprise/retraite, intéressement et participation, accès au restaurant d'entreprise et /ou tickets restaurant, couverture santé et prévoyance, activités sociales et culturelles via le comité social et économique, … De la flexibilité avec un rythme de travail hybride : jusqu'à 2,5 jours de télétravail à définir avec votre manager Rejoignez un Groupe engagé et prenez part à notre grand projet de transformation vers la construction d'un monde plus durable. Découvrez nos engagements pour notre clientèle et la société. Engagez-vous à nos côtés sur votre temps professionnel, à travers notre programme OneMillionHoursToHelp. ÊTES-VOUS NOTRE PROCHAIN OU PROCHAINE MACHINE LEARNING OPERATIONS ? Vous êtes titulaire d'une formation supérieure (BAC+4/5) en Informatique et/ou en spécialisation Datascience/Machine Learning Vous disposez d'au moins 3 ans expérience préalable en Data Science ou en Machine Learning engineering ou en tant que ML Ops Vous avez une maîtrise solide de Python Vous possédez une bonne compréhension des méthodologies DevOps / MLOps, et d'une une expérience CI/CD (Ansible, Jenkins, GitLab CI), conteneurisation (Docker, Kubernetes) et outils de suivi de modèles (MLFlow, Kubeflow). Vous avez des connaissances ou une forte appétence pour la plateforme Domino Vous avez une forte capacité à évoluer dans un environnement exigeant et orienté production Vous disposez d'une culture data et d'une compréhension des enjeux d'industrialisation des modèles. Vous vous reconnaissez à travers les compétences comportementales suivantes : Adaptabilité Rigueur Collaboration active Esprit d'analyse Esprit de synthèse LES PROCHAINES ÉTAPES : Notre processus de recrutement se déroule en plusieurs étapes structurées pour vous offrir une expérience transparente et sereine : - Une évaluation technique menée par un expert de l'équipe. - Un entretien avec le manager, souvent en binôme, pour échanger sur le rôle, l'équipe et les attentes. - Un entretien RH, destiné à valider votre adéquation avec les valeurs du Groupe ainsi que votre projet professionnel. Chaque étape est conçue pour vous permettre de mieux comprendre l'environnement et de poser toutes vos questions. Chez BNP Paribas, ce sont vos compétences qui font la différence, pas votre handicap ! Envoyez votre CV à l'Équipe Recrutement Mission Handicap : *** L'éthique, au cœur de notre recrutement Nous veillons à ce que chaque candidat agisse avec intégrité. Les informations fournies (CV, identité, antécédents) peuvent être vérifiées à tout moment du processus. Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs et collaboratrices agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle. À tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos données d'identification et vos antécédents pourront être vérifiés.

offers.title: Dessinateur Projeteur / Projets de conception d'outillage (F/H)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** Airbus Commercial Aircraft is looking for a *Design Drafter for Operations and Projects Support (m/f)* to join our Single Aisle Jigs & Tools Engineering Office (320-321) based in Toulouse, France. You will be part of a team that designs and develops tooling and assembly stations for the A320 and A321 FALs. Within the Single Aisle Jigs & Tools engineering team, as a Design Drafter, you will play a central role in the technical support of our operations. You will ensure the consistency and quality of our tooling design data while actively contributing to innovation and the definition of technical solutions. *Your working environment :* Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities ! *How we care for you :* * *Financial rewards :* Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * *Work / Life Balance :* Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * *Wellbeing / Health :* Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * *Individual development :* Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges : * * Ensure successful industrialization of Jigs and Tools assets (creation, development and modification) based on identified needs until final acceptance and handover to the corresponding Operations Manager. * Design and/or specify the requested Jigs and Tools assets according to requirements from Manuf. Engineering Process Engineer, Operations, Maintenance Engineer and Plant/ FAL Quality Assurance Representative for Jigs and Tools, as well as Human Factors, e.g. Health and Safety and Ergonomics, Environmental, Security, including Cyber Security, and legal aspects, such as Export Control or Marking. * Ensure integration of these requirements in J&T technical specification. * Ensure the provided solution is fully integrated within the industrial system through a robust acceptance process set on defined Key Performance Indicators. * Contribute to the purchasing phases of the Jigs and Tools asset, including technical specification for call for tender. * Support Finance activities to elaborate the CapEx and/or OpEx dossier. * Support Plants/ FALs in all the activities where a Jig and/or Tool asset is involved. * Support root cause analysis of Non Conformities and improvement projects. * Integrate mature industrial technologies in link with R&D. Collaborate with R&D to integrate requirements and consolidate Airbus Industrial Vision. *Your boarding pass : * * At least 10 years of experience. * CATIA V5 R27 (including utilities such as CATDUA, JTCheck). Knowledge of CATIA V6 would be a plus. * SAP. * Experience with 3D scanning tools and 3D printing is an advantage. * Knowledge of Eurocodes. * English: required (written and spoken) - B1 level. Not a 100% match ? No worries ! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. Take your career to a new level and apply online now ! #LI-JC2 This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Operations SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe E10 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Manufacturing Engineering By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: #CORE IT Operation Specialist - Intermediate Linux Support (M/F)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** *Take off with Airbus Helicopters !* *Airbus Helicopters* is looking for an* IT Operation Specialist - Intermediate Linux Support (M/F)* to join the *Digital Workplace Department* based in *Marignane, France.* Join us to shape the future of aeronautics and help protect lives during missions accomplished thanks to our helicopters. The Marignane site, the 3rd largest industrial site in France, near Marseille and Aix-en-Provence, is undergoing a deep transformation to offer a high-tech, inclusive, and environmentally friendly working environment. You will live a unique professional experience, at the heart of the manufacturing of our helicopters. To learn more about our site and our activities: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=flu57j6g-0g *Your future missions : * You will be part of a team supporting all Linux/Unix users. As part of the Industrial workplace Linux team, you will manage all Linux needs (computers/servers/applications) while being fully integrated with the overall corporate landscape (Active Directory, PKI, Network, Encryption, Security Tools...). *Your main missions will be : * * Manage the proper lifecycle of Linux computers, servers, applications from their request to their decommission. * Contribute to the detailed Setup of Linux computers, servers, applications. * Install & support the Linux computers, servers, applications. * Responsible for ensuring the good delivery through defined processes of the devices. * Propose continuous improvement on performance based on data and events analysis. * Support Product Managers to monitor their performance. * Create and update documentations for the team members. * Solve incidents and requests (hardware, network, drivers, kernel, application...). *Your profile :* * Worked in a large enterprise environment. * Worked with partners & subcontractors. * ood Knowledge of Linux system administration (Debian, Redhat, CentOS), Scripting skills (Bash, Python, Ruby, ...). * Experience or knowledge in MDM such as Foreman and associated tools (Katello, puppet, Ansible, ...), Automated deployments, updates and environment administration. * Knowledge in networking, Active directory, LDAP, NIS, PKI, virtualization, version control software, encryption tools. * Autonomy in a good team spirit is recommended as a success factor. * Good Knowledge of incident and change management based on ITIL principles. * Ability to identify root cause issues and solve them. * You are active-listener with the team and with your customers. * Open-mindedness, self-awareness, transparency, and welcome feedback will be highly appreciated skills. * Ability to work collectively, respecting Airbus values and seeking empowerment are keys. * Mindset to deliver quality whilst seeking for simplicity will be as well appreciated. * English language negotiation level is required. * French language is required. 3 Reasons to join us : *Our Values :* Six essential values form the core of our company. Defined for employees by employees, our Airbus values shape the DNA of our business, reflecting the unique mix of qualities found in each member of our global family. *Inclusion and diversity :* We foster an inclusive and rewarding work environment, where everyone's diversity is valued and respected. An inclusive and diverse workforce is the engine of *** makes us unique and contributes to better problem-solving. *Compensation and benefits :* At Airbus, we build the future together and your success is our priority. Expect a global, competitive, and transparent compensation package (including salaries, bonuses, profit-sharing, participation, and preferred share ownership plan), designed to reward the impact and performance you bring, both individually and collectively. We invest in your complete well-being: professional development (training, mentoring, international mobility), health coverage, retirement, and a commitment to a supported work-life balance (parental support, flexibility). And for your daily life, benefits that make a difference : * A dynamic CSE (Social and Economic Committee) offering many advantages (company restaurant, children's leisure center, associations and sports complex, travel allowances, etc.). * Transport facilities: Take advantage of our company shuttles or the reimbursement of your annual transport pass. *Our recruitment process :* * 1. Apply online. * 2. Analysis of your application by the recruitment department. * 3. Our positions require a security clearance, complete the questionnaire that will be sent to you. * 4. Conduct recruitment interviews: HR interview and technical interview with your future manager * 5. Receive the job offer! *Ready to take off ?* Give a new dimension to your career by applying online now! #LI-JC2 This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Helicopters SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe F12 *Experience Level:* Entry Level *Job Family:* Digital By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: Test Technologist
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** *Airbus Commercial Aircraft* is looking for a *Test Technologist (f/m)* to join our Airframe Test Centre based in *Toulouse, France.* You will be part of a team specialized in the testing of complex parts such as propulsion parts (i.e. pylon, engine mounts, nacelles...). In this job you will be in charge of the test preparation, the test performance and test monitoring until the delivery of test results. You will have the opportunity to work for all R&T and aircraft programs with a large panel of customers (Stress, Design, R&T, Systems, FALs, Flight Tests, Plants,...). *Your working environment:* Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities! *How we care for you:* * *Financial rewards*: Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * *Work / Life Balance:* Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * *Wellbeing / Health:* Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * *Individual development: * Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges:* * Specify, operate and monitor test means dedicated to structure tests, instrumentation (Hardware and software) and data acquisition systems. * Set-up and operating: * Data acquisition devices in the lab or outside (FAL, plants...). * Complex/innovating measurement systems (like DIC, other optical devices etc.). * Standard test machine for fatigue and static tests. * Multi-axial test bench (daily works like stop / unplugging for periodic inspections). * Manage the risks and issues before test preparation and test performance. Contribute to Test Management Reviews (PDR, CDR, ...) ensuring that test processes and internal standards are correctly followed. * Perform calibrations (instrumented parts, servovalves, actuators, load cells). * Perform and support impact test campaigns. * Ensure the maintenance of the test means. * Share best practices, standardize and improve processes within divisional test centers. * Bring support to answer to customer requirements (Stress, R&T, Programs, Plants, Flight Tests, FALs...). Your boarding pass: * Educated to Master degree level (or equivalent) in mechanical, physical measure engineering a related discipline. * +3 years of experience in: Aeronautical structures. * Structures test experience would be a plus (Test Rigs and Test Machines). * Software skills MOOG FCS, MTS Flextest, ZWICK TestExpert, HBK Catman enterprise, GOM, PHOTRON, INTELLIFAST would be a plus This position requires a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities. Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. Take your career to a new level and apply online now! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Operations SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe F12 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Testing By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges:* * Specify, operate and monitor test means dedicated to structure tests, instrumentation (Hardware and software) and data acquisition systems. * Set-up and operating: * Data acquisition devices in the lab or outside (FAL, plants...). * Complex/innovating measurement systems (like DIC, other optical devices etc.). * Standard test machine for fatigue and static tests. * Multi-axial test bench (daily works like stop / unplugging for periodic inspections). * Manage the risks and issues before test preparation and test performance. Contribute to Test Management Reviews (PDR, CDR, ...) ensuring that test processes and internal standards are correctly followed. * Perform calibrations (instrumented parts, servovalves, actuators, load cells). * Perform and support impact test campaigns. * Ensure the maintenance of the test means. * Share best practices, standardize and improve processes within divisional test centers. * Bring support to answer to customer requirements (Stress, R&T, Programs, Plants, Flight Tests, FALs...). Your boarding pass: * Educated to Master degree level (or equivalent) in mechanical, physical measure engineering a related discipline. * +3 years of experience in: Aeronautical structures. * Structures test experience would be a plus (Test Rigs and Test Machines). * Software skills MOOG FCS, MTS Flextest, ZWICK TestExpert, HBK Catman enterprise, GOM, PHOTRON, INTELLIFAST would be a plus This position requires a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities. offers.title: Architecte IA & Lutte contre les Manipulations de l'Information (H/F)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** *Airbus Defence and Space Cyber* is a European specialist in cybersecurity for defense and aerospace systems. Our mission is to design, develop, integrate, and deploy reliable and tailored cybersecurity solutions for our defense, government, and institutional customers. Our organization is integrated into *Airbus Defence and Space* and includes over 450 cyber professionals based at our sites in France, Germany, the UK, and Spain. We have been protecting Airbus Defence and Space's complex systems and networks for over 30 years and we leverage our Airbus DNA to develop products and solutions for customers facing challenges similar to ours. *Cyber Programmes in brief:* * We are a leading European provider protecting EU institutions. * A trusted partner for Airbus, governments, and critical industries. * We are an end-to-end integrator for cybersecurity with over 450 highly qualified professionals. * We have unique experience in platform security and embedded systems. * We have a sovereign presence in France, Germany, the UK, and Spain. To support our growth, we are recruiting an *AI & Counter-Information Manipulation Architect (M/F)* to be based in *Rennes (35), France*. You will join the Cognitive Security & Artificial Intelligence team. This position requires a security clearance or eligibility for clearance by recognized authorities. The candidate must hold French nationality in accordance with IGI 1300 of 30/11/2011 (article 65). *Your Challenges:* Join our dynamic team and contribute to the development of innovative artificial intelligence solutions. You will work on varied projects, ranging from algorithm design to machine learning model implementation, including the optimization of existing systems. You will work in close collaboration with development and operations teams to ensure the continuous delivery of our applications and services. You will also have the opportunity to work on *CyberRange* environments. * Design, develop, and deploy AI models, specifically machine learning models. * Collaborate with cybersecurity, engineering, and product teams to define needs and technical solutions. * Optimize the performance of algorithms and AI systems. * Participate in the research and evaluation of new AI technologies and methods. * Ensure the maintenance and evolution of existing solutions. * Participate in incident resolution and the implementation of corrective solutions. * Document processes and configurations to ensure traceability and reusability of project results. * Work on our flagship product: the CyberRange. * Integrate social media solutions into our infrastructures and applications. *Your Boarding Pass:* * Holder of an Engineering degree, Master's, or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Cybersecurity, or a related field. * Experience in developing machine learning algorithms (with TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.) and NLP (spaCy, NLTK, etc.). * Experience with *GenAI* models and *RAG* techniques, embeddings, prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and adaptation of pre-trained models. * Experience in AI system design and architecture, preferably in contexts related to content moderation, disinformation detection, or cybersecurity. * Proficiency in languages such as *Python* and *bash*. * Understanding of DevOps principles and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) practices. * Knowledge of on-premise solution integration. * Knowledge of CyberRange environments. * Initiative and ability to learn quickly. * Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively. * Sense of innovation and curiosity for new technologies. *What We Offer:* * A dynamic and innovative work environment. * Professional development and training opportunities. * Competitive remuneration and attractive social benefits. * The possibility to work on exciting projects with high added value. *Why Join Us?* * Work for a European specialist in Cyber Security, within a team of experts developing reliable and high-performance products and services for extraordinary customers positioned in key markets. * Join the Airbus group and benefit from a work environment fostering your skills development through training as well as an evolving career plan adapted to your profile. * Evolve in a balanced work environment: Beyond the many benefits offered to its employees, joining the Airbus group is also the guarantee of a respected balance between professional and private life. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect, and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. Looking for a new challenge or a new career project in Cyber Security within a structure at the cutting edge of the industry? Look no further and join Airbus CyberSecurity! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Cybersecurity SAS *Contract Type:* Permanent ----- Classe Emploi (France): Classe G13 *Experience Level:* Entry Level *Job Family:* Cyber Security By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. offers.title: INGÉNIEUR MACHINE LEARNING
offers.description_raw:
Au sein de la section IA, l'ingénieur en Machine Learning est en charge du développement, de l'industrialisation de modèles et de projets IA. À l'aide de compétences techniques avancées en ingénierie de données, en apprentissage automatique et à travers la connaissance du MLOps, il contribue à la transformation numérique des métiers en implémentant des cas d'usage propres au service. - Concevoir, entrainer et évaluer des modèles d'IA - Mettre un modèle en production / créer une UI - Documenter les solutions dans leur ensemble - Industrialiser des modèles d'IA ou autres produits issus des Sciences de Données dans des applications intégrables à l'écosystème SI du service

Expérience technique dans le domaine du Machine Learning. Diplôme en informatique avec spécialité Data Science / Machine Learning. -Langage de programmation Python et ses librairies et ML. -Outil de containerisation : Docker -Outil de développement collaboratif basé sur Git -DevOps, MLOps

Direction du renseignement et de la sécurité de la Défense (DRSD)

offers.title: Avionics Computer Safety Architect (F/M)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** *Airbus Commercial Aircraft* is looking for a *Avionics Computer Safety Architect (f/m)* to join our Avionics Products Development team based in *Toulouse, France.* The Avionics & Simulation Domain, so-called 'Chamber of Reference', is currently developing several brand new computers based on the Avionics product line while establishing new Ways of Working along with maintaining legacy Avionics products. Within the Avionic Product department of this domain, Raphaël Migliasso , Head of Avionics Product Architecture and Safety is looking for a new Avionics Computer Safety Architect to join his team of 15 people in Toulouse, France. *Your working environment :* Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities ! *How we care for you :* * *Financial rewards :* Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * *Work / Life Balance :* Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * *Wellbeing / Health :* Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * *Individual development : *Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges : * * The development of a new Avionic computer - usually based on the Avionics product line or * The development of a new standard of a Legacy Avionic computer * The follow-up of Legacy Avionic computer Both types of development require to perform the main safety&reliability following activities : * Assess safety and reliability characteristics of the computer with the implication of specialists and experts on all required competencies (e.g. hardware, software, quality) * Contribute to the definition of the safest computer architecture with the product but also the hardware and software architect * Follow-up product maturity - with a Safety focus - through V&V anomalies analysis, prioritization of correction of anomalies and industrialisation follow-up * Secure Safety analysis and demonstration for certification * Follow-up of Legacy Avionic computer mainly encompasses Safety analysis of problems encountered in service plus related Safety recommendations. You will be supported by Technical Authority and/or 'Experts' of the domain for negotiations/trade-offs involving external bodies and/or to build-up/validate strategy/plan to sort out 'critical' issues but also to support you in the preparation of certification evidences. *Your boarding pass : * * Strong experiences in Equipment/System level development with experiences in Hardware & Software development; * Good knowledge of safety&reliability methodologies/approaches * Good knowledge of aeronautical stakes/regulations (e.g. ARP4754, DO178, DO254, DO160); * Good analysis / synthesis skills * Good communication & negotiations kills; * A negotiation level of French and English is required Not a 100% match ? No worries ! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. Take your career to a new level and apply online now ! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Operations SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe G14 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Computing&Comm and Info& Data Processing By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. offers.title: ATR - Avionics Functions and Cockpit Display Design Leader
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** * About us * ATR is the *world's number one aircraft manufacturer in regional aviation* providing a new generation of turboprops. We are a joint venture between *two European aeronautical heavyweights, Airbus and Leonardo. * From the world's largest cities, to our planet's most remote regions*, our purpose is to deliver air travel* to people, communities and businesses in an *innovative, sustainable and modern way.* If you strive for excellence, are driven by *ambition*, *trust *and *respect* as we are, then get your career off to a flighting start with ATR! *Our leadership profile:* * People Centric Entrepreneurial Inspiring Exemplary Innovative Humble * * At ATR y **ou will work with passionate colleagues to make a difference in a human size company with attractive advantages! * We are looking for an *Avionics Functions and Cockpit Display Design Leader* to come onboard in our *Engineering ** Directorate * in *David*'s team : a team of *15 *collaborators! [career Path: Job Referent] * Your Mission * The perimeter of Avionics Department in ATR Engineering is: * ATA 22 - Autopilot * ATA 23 - Audio / Communications * ATA 31 - Indicating / Alerting / Recording * ATA 34 - Navigation / Surveillance * ATA 42 - Modular Avionics * ATA 45 - Maintenance * ATA 46 - EFB The jobholder is responsible for the development and follow-up of the Avionics Suite on ATR42 and ATR72 programs. * Lead cockpit functions and cockpit display design in compliance with applicable technical design directives and certification rules (FAR/JAR/CS25, CRIs, IPs...), * Ensure technology and regulation watch, * Participate in research programs, * Specify, develop, and integrate Systems and Equipment in accordance with ATR product policy, * Release Specifications and Statements of Work, participate in supplier selection (RFI/RFP), conduct progress meetings, and monitor the development and adjustment of the concerned aircraft-installed systems, * Contribute to Certification Program and develop the Means of Compliance documents required for certification ; discussions with Certification Authorities, * Issue technical data to support Operational and Maintenance documentation updates, * Verify ATR and Vendor Service Bulletins, * Support the Production Line in case of issues in the production phase, and during flight tests and delivery (assembly anomalies, troubleshooting, concessions, repairs...), * Provide technical support to the Customers and other ATR directorates in their missions, * Manage technical relationships with Avionics equipment suppliers, * Draft Airlines information documents (SIL), * For aircraft events, contribute to identify the rootcauses and to provide expertise on parts found to be defective. If required, suggest adapted preventive/corrective solutions as well as applicable procedures, * Analyse in-service occurrences and evaluate the need for reporting, * Technical support to ICAO Annex 13 investigations. * About you * * Field of study in aeronautics * Good experience (>10 years) in the development/support of aeronautical electronics systems, in particular ATA 31 (Indicating), ATA 34 (Navigation and Surveillance) ATA 22 (Autopilot), including both legacy (analogical, SAO...) and state-of-the-art (digital, SCADE...) technologies. * Knowledge of A/C regulations (JAR/CS/FAR 25, Part 21...), development processes and standards (e.g. ARP4754A, ARP4761...), qualification standards (e.g. DO160G, DO178C... and/or EUROCAE equivalent) * General knowledges of activities (production, support, procurement...) within an aircraft manufacturer * Knowledge in "Safety", "Human factors" and "Cyber-security" processes * Experience in project management * Soft skills: good relationship skills, ability to communicate with various stakeholders (external: Authorities, Partners, Suppliers, Customers... ; internal: Production, Quality, Procurement, Program, Customers Support, Marketing and Sales...) and in a multi-cultural environment. * Fluent in English and French (Italian is a plus) * ... but above all, you are ready to take off with us to keep connecting communities and businesses and provide the best possible products and support to our customers! * Our Recruitment Process * * *David* will contact you * Innovative and digital assessment * To get to know you better: interview with *David* then with Mehdi HR Recruiter * What we offer * * Highly competitive compensation package * (profit and success sharing, employee savings plan...) * Work-life balance * (remote working, 6th week of paid leave, additional days off for family events...) * Well-being / health * (supplementary health & welfare coverage...) * Career paths * enabling employees to develop their skills and build a professional project * Wide choice of development programs * for soft and hard skills * CSE: * ATR (family and employee events) and Airbus CSE (travel, vacation camps ...) * Diversity* *and inclusion*: Over 1200 men & women with more than 35 different nationalities work together in our teams ! ATR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. * A propos d'ATR * ATR est le *premier constructeur mondial d'avions régionaux* et propose une nouvelle génération de turbopropulseurs. Nous sommes une *filiale de deux poids lourds de l'aéronautique européenne, Airbus et Leonardo. * Des plus grandes villes du monde aux régions les plus reculées de notre planète, *notre objectif est d'assurer le transport aérien* des personnes, des communautés et des entreprises d'une manière innovante, durable et moderne. Si vous recherchez l'excellence, si vous êtes animé par *l'ambition,* la *confiance* et le *respect,* alors faites décoller votre carrière avec ATR *! * *Notre Leadership Profile : * *Centré(e) sur l'humain un esprit entrepreneur inspirant(e) exemplaire innovant(e) humble* *Vous travaillerez avec des collègues passionnés pour faire la différence dans une entreprise à taille humaine avec des avantages attractifs ! * Nous recherchons un *Responsable du Design des fonctions avioniques et des affichages cockpit *pour rejoindre notre Direction *Engineering *au sein de l'équipe de *David* : une équipe de *15* collaborateurs ! [career Path: Job Referent] * Votre mission * Le périmètre du département Avionique d'ATR Engineering est le suivant : * ATA 22 - Pilote automatique * ATA 23 - Audio / Communications * ATA 31 - Indication / Alerte / Enregistrement * ATA 34 - Navigation / Surveillance * ATA 42 - Avionique modulaire * ATA 45 - Maintenance * ATA 46 - EFB Le titulaire du poste est responsable du développement et du suivi de la suite avionique des programmes ATR42 et ATR72. * Piloter le design des fonctions avioniques et des affichages cockpit en conformité avec les directives de conception technique et les règles de certification applicables (FAR/JAR/CS25, CRI, IP...). * Assurer une veille technologique et réglementaire. * Participer aux programmes de recherche. * Spécifier, développer et intégrer les systèmes et équipements conformément à la politique produit d'ATR. * Publier les spécifications et les cahiers des charges, participer à la sélection des fournisseurs (RFI/RFP), animer les réunions d'avancement et suivre le développement et les ajustements des systèmes embarqués concernés. * Contribuer au programme de certification et élaborer les documents de moyens de conformité requis pour la certification ; échanges avec les autorités de certification. * Fournir des données techniques pour la mise à jour des documents d'exploitation et de maintenance. * Vérifier les bulletins de service ATR et fournisseurs. * Assister la chaîne de production en cas de problèmes en phase de production, lors des essais en vol et de la livraison (anomalies d'assemblage, dépannage, concessions, réparations...). * Fournir un support technique aux clients et aux autres directions d'ATR dans leurs missions. * Gérer les relations techniques avec les fournisseurs d'équipements avioniques. * Rédiger les documents d'information des compagnies aériennes (SIL). * Pour les événements aéronautiques, contribuer à…
offers.description_poste: **Job Description:** * About us * ATR is the *world's number one aircraft manufacturer in regional aviation* providing a new generation of turboprops. We are a joint venture between *two European aeronautical heavyweights, Airbus and Leonardo. * From the world's largest cities, to our planet's most remote regions*, our purpose is to deliver air travel* to people, communities and businesses in an *innovative, sustainable and modern way.* If you strive for excellence, are driven by *ambition*, *trust *and *respect* as we are, then get your career off to a flighting start with ATR! *Our leadership profile:* * People Centric Entrepreneurial Inspiring Exemplary Innovative Humble * * At ATR y **ou will work with passionate colleagues to make a difference in a human size company with attractive advantages! * We are looking for an *Avionics Functions and Cockpit Display Design Leader* to come onboard in our *Engineering ** Directorate * in *David*'s team : a team of *15 *collaborators! [career Path: Job Referent] * Your Mission * The perimeter of Avionics Department in ATR Engineering is: * ATA 22 - Autopilot * ATA 23 - Audio / Communications * ATA 31 - Indicating / Alerting / Recording * ATA 34 - Navigation / Surveillance * ATA 42 - Modular Avionics * ATA 45 - Maintenance * ATA 46 - EFB The jobholder is responsible for the development and follow-up of the Avionics Suite on ATR42 and ATR72 programs. * Lead cockpit functions and cockpit display design in compliance with applicable technical design directives and certification rules (FAR/JAR/CS25, CRIs, IPs...), * Ensure technology and regulation watch, * Participate in research programs, * Specify, develop, and integrate Systems and Equipment in accordance with ATR product policy, * Release Specifications and Statements of Work, participate in supplier selection (RFI/RFP), conduct progress meetings, and monitor the development and adjustment of the concerned aircraft-installed systems, * Contribute to Certification Program and develop the Means of Compliance documents required for certification ; discussions with Certification Authorities, * Issue technical data to support Operational and Maintenance documentation updates, * Verify ATR and Vendor Service Bulletins, * Support the Production Line in case of issues in the production phase, and during flight tests and delivery (assembly anomalies, troubleshooting, concessions, repairs...), * Provide technical support to the Customers and other ATR directorates in their missions, * Manage technical relationships with Avionics equipment suppliers, * Draft Airlines information documents (SIL), * For aircraft events, contribute to identify the rootcauses and to provide expertise on parts found to be defective. If required, suggest adapted preventive/corrective solutions as well as applicable procedures, * Analyse in-service occurrences and evaluate the need for reporting, * Technical support to ICAO Annex 13 investigations. * About you * * Field of study in aeronautics * Good experience (>10 years) in the development/support of aeronautical electronics systems, in particular ATA 31 (Indicating), ATA 34 (Navigation and Surveillance) ATA 22 (Autopilot), including both legacy (analogical, SAO...) and state-of-the-art (digital, SCADE...) technologies. * Knowledge of A/C regulations (JAR/CS/FAR 25, Part 21...), development processes and standards (e.g. ARP4754A, ARP4761...), qualification standards (e.g. DO160G, DO178C... and/or EUROCAE equivalent) * General knowledges of activities (production, support, procurement...) within an aircraft manufacturer * Knowledge in "Safety", "Human factors" and "Cyber-security" processes * Experience in project management * Soft skills: good relationship skills, ability to communicate with various stakeholders (external: Authorities, Partners, Suppliers, Customers... ; internal: Production, Quality, Procurement, Program, Customers Support, Marketing and Sales...) and in a multi-cultural environment. * Fluent in English and French (Italian is a plus) * ... but above all, you are ready to take off with us to keep connecting communities and businesses and provide the best possible products and support to our customers! * Our Recruitment Process * * *David* will contact you * Innovative and digital assessment * To get to know you better: interview with *David* then with Mehdi HR Recruiter * What we offer * * Highly competitive compensation package * (profit and success sharing, employee savings plan...) * Work-life balance * (remote working, 6th week of paid leave, additional days off for family events...) * Well-being / health * (supplementary health & welfare coverage...) * Career paths * enabling employees to develop their skills and build a professional project * Wide choice of development programs * for soft and hard skills * CSE: * ATR (family and employee events) and Airbus CSE (travel, vacation camps ...) * Diversity* *and inclusion*: Over 1200 men & women with more than 35 different nationalities work together in our teams ! ATR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. * A propos d'ATR * ATR est le *premier constructeur mondial d'avions régionaux* et propose une nouvelle génération de turbopropulseurs. Nous sommes une *filiale de deux poids lourds de l'aéronautique européenne, Airbus et Leonardo. * Des plus grandes villes du monde aux régions les plus reculées de notre planète, *notre objectif est d'assurer le transport aérien* des personnes, des communautés et des entreprises d'une manière innovante, durable et moderne. offers.title: Thrust Reverser Actuation System Integrator (m/f)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** Airbus Commercial Aircraft is looking for a *Thrust Reverser Actuation System Integrator (m/f)* to join our Engine & Nacelle Systems team based in Toulouse, France. As part of the Propulsion Systems & Control Laws team in Toulouse you will be responsible for specifying and co-designing, together with Airbus suppliers particularly engine and nacelle systems suppliers. You will define and resolve the technical challenges of the propulsion system, its interactions with other aircraft systems and components under all operating conditions. You will propose design solutions and perform trade studies, while steering and challenging the contributions proposed by our suppliers. Within aircraft pre-development teams and R&T (Research & Technology) projects, you will interact with a wide international community of stakeholders, both internally within Airbus (Chief Engineers, experts, flight test, production, customer support, etc.) and externally with industrial partners such as engine manufacturers, system and equipment suppliers, and research centers. *Your working environment :* Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities! *How we care for you :* * *Financial rewards :* Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * *Work / Life Balance :* Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * *Wellbeing / Health :* Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * *Individual development :* Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. *Your challenges : * Develop new technologies, functions, concepts, and architectures within R&T programs and pre-development aircraft, define the associated roadmaps, and develop the corresponding ground or flight demonstrators. The key challenges of this new position are to : * Be able to develop improved architectures and technologies (e.g. actuator synchronization architectures) for Thrust Reverser Actuation Systems (TRAS), generating aircraft-level benefits (e.g. weight, maintenance costs, etc.). * Coordinate key nacelle and TRAS suppliers, as well as internal teams (e.g. control laws, aircraft systems, thermal, safety, physical integration...), in order to mature these technologies. * Implement efficient and innovative methods (functional approach, MBSE, pre-sizing). * Develop and strengthen internal expertise to be more efficient in future developments. *Your boarding pass : * For this position, we are particularly looking for an experienced engineer in system design and integration, ideally in the field of electrical actuation systems. Experience in engine and nacelle systems integration would be an advantage. * Graduate engineer or equivalent in aeronautics, mechanical engineering, and systems engineering * Systems Engineering skills (model-based): from operational analysis to requirements identification * Multi-physics integration skills, particularly in system-structure interaction * Systems behavior modeling skills (e.g. AMESim) * Strong initiative, autonomy, innovative mindset, and open-mindedness * Strong sense of integrity and compliance with company, industry, and ethical standards * Languages: English at negotiation level; French, German, or Spanish are considered a plus * Ability to work in an international context and within an extended enterprise environment Additional experience or knowledge in the following areas would be a plus for certain positions: * Propulsion systems * Data analytics and artificial intelligence * Project or team management Not a 100% match ? No worries ! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. Take your career to a new level and apply online now ! This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Operations SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe F12 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Powerplant and Propulsion By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: Avionics Computer Architect (M/F)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** * Airbus Commercial Aircraft * is looking for an * Avionics Computer Architect (f/m) * to join our * Avionics & Simulation * Domain based in * Toulouse, France. * The Avionics & Simulation Domain - so-called 'Chamber of Reference' - is currently developing several brand new computers based on the Avionics product line while establishing new Ways of Working. You will be part of the Architect & Safety team (~15 people) maintaining Legacy Avionics Products and developing new Avionic Products based on the Avionics product line.. * Your working environment: * Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities! * How we care for you: * * * Financial rewards: * Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. * * Work / Life Balance: * Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. * * Wellbeing / Health: * Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. * * Individual development: * Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. * Your challenges: * Within this exciting and challenging context, you will play a key role (depending on your profile and wishes) in: * the development of a new Avionic product - usually based on the Avionics product line or * the development of a new standard of a Legacy Avionic product or * the follow-up of Legacy Avionic product Both types of development require to perform the main following activities: * Manage/challenge the product specification with regards to the needs and the feasibility (e.g. wrt the product line capability); * Define the best product architecture (or updated architecture in case of a Legacy product) and then the related requirements (incl. requirements on Perf., Safety, Quality, Industrial & environmental) and, ultimately, allocate these requirements among Hardware&Software teams through trade-off if required * Follow-up product maturity through contribution to V&V prioritization activities, prioritization of correction of anomalies and industrialisation follow-up * Contribute to safety analysis and demonstration for certification Follow-up of Legacy Avionic computer mainly encompasses analysis of problems encountered in service plus related recommendations. If you are a passionate and enthusiastic * Electronic and Software Specialist * , wishing to develop your expertise, this job - in such a domain - is made for you ! * Your boarding pass: * * Strong experiences in Equipment/System level development with experiences in Hardware & Software development; * Good knowledge of aeronautical stakes/regulations (e.g. ARP4754, DO178, DO254, DO160); * Good analysis / synthesis skills * Good communication & negotiations kills; * A negotiation level of French and English is required Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. Take your career to a new level and apply online now!
