offers.title: Ingénieur Développeur logiciel – Solution Saas
offers.description_raw:
Intégré(e) à une équipe de développement expérimentée, vous participerez à la conception et à l'évolution de la plateforme SaaS de gestion de commandes, utilisée par des enseignes majeures du retail. Au quotidien : • Concevoir, développer et maintenir des services performants et évolutifs au sein d'une architecture microservices. • Garantir la qualité, la fiabilité et la performance du code produit par l'équipe. • Participer aux choix techniques, aux conceptions d'architecture et à la réduction de la dette technique. • Contribuer activement aux revues de code et à la montée en compétence des développeurs plus juniors. • Expérimenter de nouvelles approches technologiques, notamment liées à la data et à l'intelligence artificielle. • Mettre en place du monitoring applicatif et identifier les leviers d'amélioration continue. Environnement technologique : Go / Python / TypeScript / Vue.js / microservices / cloud / CI-CD Pourquoi rejoindre cette entreprise ? Un rôle stratégique : création d'un produit logiciel from-scratch Un environnement stimulant : stack récente, équipe agile de 10 personnes, collaboration avec des UX designers. Une entreprise solide : 20 M€ de CA, croissance continue, portefeuille clients prestigieux Des conditions attractives : 1 mois de participation,10 RTT/an, télétravail flexible : jusqu'à 2 jours/semaine Lieu : Toulouse Contrat : CDI Salaire : Jusqu'à 55K fixe Si votre profil correspond, nous reviendrons vers vous dans les 7 jours à compter de la date d'envoi.

- Formation supérieure en informatique (Bac+5 ou équivalent) - Minimum 3 ans d'expérience en développement backend ou fullstack sur des applications SaaS à fort trafic - Solides compétences sur au moins un langage parmi Go, Python ou TypeScript - Bonne compréhension des architectures distribuées et des bonnes pratiques de développement - Anglais technique (oral et écrit) requis

Notre client est un éditeur de logiciels français spécialisé dans les solutions d'orchestration et de gestion de commandes omnicanales. Fondée il y a plus de 10 ans, l'entreprise accompagne de grandes marques européennes dans la transformation digitale de leurs opérations e-commerce et retail. Ses solutions permettent d'unifier les stocks (magasins, entrepôts, fournisseurs) et d'optimiser le traitement des commandes pour offrir une promesse de livraison fiable et en temps réel. Portée par une croissance soutenue et un important investissement de fonds internationaux, la société accélère son développement et renforce ses équipes techniques avec le recrutement d'un Software Engineer .
offers.description_poste: Intégré(e) à une équipe de développement expérimentée, vous participerez à la conception et à l'évolution de la plateforme SaaS de gestion de commandes, utilisée par des enseignes majeures du retail. Au quotidien : • Concevoir, développer et maintenir des services performants et évolutifs au sein d'une architecture microservices. • Garantir la qualité, la fiabilité et la performance du code produit par l'équipe. • Participer aux choix techniques, aux conceptions d'architecture et à la réduction de la dette technique. • Contribuer activement aux revues de code et à la montée en compétence des développeurs plus juniors. • Expérimenter de nouvelles approches technologiques, notamment liées à la data et à l'intelligence artificielle. • Mettre en place du monitoring applicatif et identifier les leviers d'amélioration continue. Environnement technologique : Go / Python / TypeScript / Vue.js / microservices / cloud / CI-CD Pourquoi rejoindre cette entreprise ? Un rôle stratégique : création d'un produit logiciel from-scratch Un environnement stimulant : stack récente, équipe agile de 10 personnes, collaboration avec des UX designers. Une entreprise solide : 20 M€ de CA, croissance continue, portefeuille clients prestigieux Des conditions attractives : 1 mois de participation,10 RTT/an, télétravail flexible : jusqu'à 2 jours/semaine Lieu : Toulouse Contrat : CDI Salaire : Jusqu'à 55K fixe Si votre profil correspond, nous reviendrons vers vous dans les 7 jours à compter de la date d'envoi.
offers.description_profil: - Formation supérieure en informatique (Bac+5 ou équivalent) - Minimum 3 ans d'expérience en développement backend ou fullstack sur des applications SaaS à fort trafic - Solides compétences sur au moins un langage parmi Go, Python ou TypeScript - Bonne compréhension des architectures distribuées et des bonnes pratiques de développement - Anglais technique (oral et écrit) requis

offers.title: Développeur Backend (Python) H/F
offers.description_raw:
En postulant à cette offre, vous aurez l'opportunité de rejoindre une startup développant des technologies de pointe pour l'entraînement de réseaux de Deep Learning et la création d'applications basées sur la vision. Leur approche est axée sur la fusion de la génération de données synthétiques avec des données réelles pour permettre le prochain bond en avant dans la compréhension visuelle pilotée par l'IA. Fiabiliser notre plateforme de génération de datasets synthétiques annotés en construisant des tests automatisés et des contrôles de qualité des données (images/annotations/métadonnées). Après la mise sous contrôle initiale, contribuer activement au développement backend produit (Python, et potentiellement JS/TS selon périmètre). Vos missions si vous les acceptez : Phase 1 (mise sous contrôle / fiabilisation) Développer en Python des tests/validations de bout en bout (sampling de paramètres, fuzzing contrôlé, runs batch, non-régression) Mettre en place des checks de qualité des données sur les outputs (images + annotations + métadonnées) : invariants, cohérences JSON/annotations, présence attendue, métriques/distributions Collecter erreurs + métriques, améliorer triage, reproductibilité et reporting Intégrer ces validations dans des runs réguliers/CI Phase 2 (contribution produit backend régulière) Contribuer au module Python de traduction requêtes haut niveau → bas niveau (évolutions + non-régression) Contribuer au post-processing Python (QA data, filtrage/scoring qualité, conversion/export annotations) Participer aux évolutions backend (APIs/services) selon la roadmap

Et vous ! Grand minimum 5 ans d'expérience en Software Engineer ou developer back-end Diplôme d'ingénieur en école ou université Savoir faire des tests automatisés et/ou avoir des compétences data (Python, datascience...) Profil français ou européen pour travailler avec la défense Fluent anglais et français B2 au moins Stack technique : Python CI/CD Optionnel: JavaScript/TypeScript Optionnel: Tests API/UI Optionnel: Playwright/Cypress/Selenium

Lancé en 2021, Team.is est u ne start-up de recrutement spécialisée dans la chasse et le recrutement de profils IT, Digital, Ingénierie & Supply Chain. Team.is c'est avant tout une entreprise à taille humaine animée par la passion du recrutement ! Team.is possède l'expertise et l'énergie pour s'attaquer à n'importe quel défi. Mais nous ne sommes pas des robots du recrutement. Nous sommes des consultants qui vivent et respirent ce que nous faisons ! Nous sommes déterminés à réaliser le meilleur travail possible pour cultiver des relations durables avec nos candidats et nos clients.

offers.title: Technical rater (F/M)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** Airbus Helicopters is looking for a *Technical Rater (f/m)* to join our site based in Marignane, France. You will join a dynamic and exciting engineering department with teams managing: * Export Control & National Security Classification * Export Control & National Security Flow Management * Data Leadership & Quality You will be joining the team of Export Control & National Security Classification *Your working environment:* Major economic hub with Marseille-Provence Airport, Marignane is a dynamic city in the southeast of France. It is located near the cities of Aix-en-Provence and Marseille, which host a rich cultural and tourist offer. Close to the beaches of the Côte Bleue, it offers many options for water sports activities. *How we care for you:* *Financial rewards:* Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis. *Work / Life Balance:* Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. *Wellbeing / Health:* Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application. *Individual development: * Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility. * At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. * *Your challenges:* * You will be trained to become a Technical Rater (Export control classification specialist) * Support export control classification leader to coordinate export control classification tasks * Support engineering teams to classify technical data according to export control regulations * Contribute to continuous improvement of export control classification solutions *Your profile:* * * Engineer or Technician experienced with technical data/product analysis * * Experience in export control classification is of advantage * Experience in project management * Fluent in English and German, French could be a bonus. This position requires a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities. * Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions. * Take your career to a new level and apply online now! #LI-MN1 This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Helicopters SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe F12 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Ethics & Compliance By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: Tech Lead Python -Orienté IA – Réassureur international
offers.description_raw:
En 2021, pour accompagner leur transformation, la société a créé une Digital Factory , composé de 15 personnes et réparti en 3 pôles ; data, digital office et un pôle stratégique Lab & IA. Vous prendrez le lead technique du pôle IA en tant que Tech Lead Python Orienté IA. Vous réaliserez la définition et le cadrage de l'architecture, le renforcement des standards de développement, de fiabilisation des environnements, sécurisation des intégrations LLM et montée en qualité globale des applications. Vous encadrerez techniquement un ML Engineer (prestataire) et un Analytics Engineer , en apportant méthode, priorisation et exigence . Vous développerez des outils IA qui assisteront directement les équipes métiers dans leurs décisions stratégiques, notamment via l'analyse automatisée de contrats et l'exploitation de la GenIA pour accélérer et fiabiliser les processus de réassurance. L'enjeu n'est plus d'expérimenter, mais d'industrialiser et de structurer durablement ces solutions. Votre rôle consistera également à travailler en lien étroit avec les équipes métiers pour aligner les choix techniques avec les enjeux business , et faire passer les projets IA d'un stade avancé à un niveau pleinement robuste, scalable et exploitable en environnement entreprise. Environnement technologique : Backend : Python, développement applicatif métier, intégration API Infrastructure : Kubernetes, Docker, GitLab (CI/CD), architecture cloud. IA & Data : Machine Learning, IA Générative (GenAI), intégration LLM (open source) Pourquoi rejoindre cette société ? …

5+ ans d'expérience en développement Python. Leadership technique , avec une première expérience d'encadrement appréciée. Maîtrise des bonnes pratiques de développement et d'architecture, en environnement cloud . Idéalement une connaissance du secteur assurance / réassurance.

Parmi les 30 principaux réassureurs mondiaux, notre client est un réassureur international fondé en 2015, basé à Paris et présent dans plus de 100 pays. Il accompagne les compagnies d'assurance, permet à ses entreprises de répartir leurs risques et de renforcer leur solidité financière face aux sinistres importants. Dans le cadre de leur croissance, ils ont pour objectif d'offrir un service de première qualité à leur client et d'être un acteur de pointe dans l'analyse des risques et la digitalisation des processus. Après une première phase d'expérimentation et d'innovation, l'entreprise entre aujourd'hui dans une étape plus concrète : structurer ce qui a été lancé, rendre les solutions stables, avec un fort objectif d'efficacité et de résultats. L'entreprise souhaite rapatrier la data en interne et limiter sa dépendance au cloud, en revenant vers un environnement plus fermé en on-premise, afin de mieux maîtriser son infrastructure. Dans ce contexte, l'entreprise recherche un Tech Lead Python & IA.

offers.title: SE/MBSE - Avionics Systems Engineering leader (m/f)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** Exciting Opportunities have been raised for Systems Engineering [SE] and Model Based Systems Engineering [MBSE] leaders supporting end to end new Helicopters Systems development within Airbus Helicopters. Airbus Helicopters is undergoing a significant digital transformation to benefit from the latest advances in new technologies and targets which is a major efficiency breakthrough across programs and product lifecycle. It will be enabled through a set of innovative concepts such as "Model Based Systems Engineering", modular product lines, digital continuity, and concurrent co-development of the product, industrial setup and service features. You will join the Avionics Systems Architecture Department and will integrate multifunctional and transnational team working on Systems Engineering and MBSE deployment. You will be responsible to mature & deploy a common SE/MBSE understanding and common frameworks inside Airbus Helicopters for architecting and developing in the right way (effective & efficient) our products. You will support innovative concepts to capture customers' needs, to capture discipline knowledge, specify & define architecture from the early stage to detailed definition and assess architecture in a more systematic way (in particular through operability, safety, security and performance standpoints). You will support digitization applying semantic web techniques to maintain a good data continuity between product, process, methods & tools, based on ontology and also promote the usage of AI in such discipline (Advanced MBSE, MBE). * As part of Avionics Systems Architecture Department, you will be responsible for: * Systems activities: * Contribute to Systems developments by fostering SE/MBSE, coaching/mentoring team, * Support to certification/qualification audits, Process, Method & Tools activities : * Promoting into Systems Directorate, the extended use of state-of-the art SE/MBSE methodologies on legacy and emerging Programs and monitoring the deployment, in particular, on the MBSE activities benefiting to Product Architecture performances, from requirements establishment until in cycle, but also during design & intermediate phases to ultimate V&V process, * Defining and maintaining harmonized MBSE & Architecture framework (supporting out of cycle and in cycle development phase) in close collaboration with other Airbus Helicopters Entities and in coherence with programs & demonstrators roadmaps, * Modelling environment preparation for Systems development projects, * Model consistency reviews/audits, * Models Configuration management for Systems. A System Engineering process, based on ARP4754, is supporting all the daily tasks and requires a certain level of formalization. * Education: * * Engineer in Avionics, or Electronics or Systems Engineering * Experience: 5-10 years or more * Languages: Fluent in French and English To achieve all these missions, the candidate will have to be: * Rigorous and methodic in his/her daily tasks, * 'Customer satisfaction' oriented, * 'Open-minded' and 'welcome problems' attitude, * Dynamic and having a strong "team spirit" mindset, * Able to work in complex environments and to manage easily priorities/urgencies, * Transparent and report issue as soon as it appears, * Positive and constructive On top of this, knowledge on the following items, could be a plus: * Modelling & Simulation experience (including technics, standards as SysML, UML, BPMN & tools as HOPEX, CAMEO & CATIA or 3DX) * Ontology modelling (standards as OWL, tools as HOPEX) * Operational & functional analysis (MOFL) This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Helicopters SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe G13 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Chief Engineering & Architecture By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

A System Engineering process, based on ARP4754, is supporting all the daily tasks and requires a certain level of formalization. * Education: * * Engineer in Avionics, or Electronics or Systems Engineering * Experience: 5-10 years or more * Languages: Fluent in French and English To achieve all these missions, the candidate will have to be: * Rigorous and methodic in his/her daily tasks, * 'Customer satisfaction' oriented, * 'Open-minded' and 'welcome problems' attitude, * Dynamic and having a strong "team spirit" mindset, * Able to work in complex environments and to manage easily priorities/urgencies, * Transparent and report issue as soon as it appears, * Positive and constructive On top of this, knowledge on the following items, could be a plus: * Modelling & Simulation experience (including technics, standards as SysML, UML, BPMN & tools as HOPEX, CAMEO & CATIA or 3DX) * Ontology modelling (standards as OWL, tools as HOPEX) * Operational & functional analysis (MOFL) This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus Helicopters SAS *Employment Type:* Permanent ------- Classe Emploi (France): Classe G13 *Experience Level:* Professional *Job Family:* Chief Engineering & Architecture By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: Internship OPTIMAN : Design and optimisation of a Physical and Virtual Model of a Flexible and Robotised Production Workshop: machining cells application
offers.description_raw:
Laboratory presentation CESI LINEACT (UR 7527), Laboratory for Digital Innovation for Businesses and Learning to Support the Competitiveness of Territories, anticipates and accompanies the technological mutations of sectors and services related to industry and construction. The historical proximity of CESI to companies is a determining factor in our research activities. It has led us to focus our efforts on applied research close to companies and in partnership with them. A human-centered approach coupled with the use of technologies, as well as territorial networking and links with training, has enabled the construction of cross-cutting research; it puts humans, their needs, and their uses at the center of its issues and addresses the technological angle through these contributions. Its research is organized according to two interdisciplinary scientific teams and several application areas. Team 1 'Learning and Innovating' mainly concerns Cognitive Sciences, Social Sciences, and Management Sciences, Training Techniques, and those of Innovation. The main scientific objectives are the understanding of the effects of the environment, and, more particularly, of situations instrumented by technical objects (platforms, prototyping workshops, immersive systems...) on learning, creativity, and innovation processes. Team 2 'Engineering and Digital Tools' mainly concerns Digital Sciences and Engineering. The main scientific objectives focus on modeling, simulation, optimization, and data analysis of cyber-physical systems. Research also focuses on decision-support tools and on the study of human-system interactions, particularly through digital twins coupled with virtual or augmented environments. These two teams develop and cross their research in application areas such as Industry 5.0, Construction 4.0 and Sustainable City, Digital Services. Areas supported by research platforms, mainly the one in Rouen dedicated to Factory 5.0 and the one in Nanterre dedicated to Factory 5.0 and Construction 4.0. Abstract This internship aims to design and evaluate a human-centred decision-support system based on a digital twin of a robotic machining cell, in order to jointly optimise production performance and operator well-being. In this cell, the production schedule combines manual operations performed by human workers with automatic operations executed by robots and CNC machines; therefore, the planning and its supporting tools must be explicitly human-centric and help improve working conditions rather than focus only on throughput. Concretely, the intern will work on connecting an existing digital twin of the cell to a scheduling module (based on optimisation algorithms) and on designing interaction mechanisms that keep the human "in the loop": visualisation of schedules, comparison of alternative scenarios, simple actions such as changing priorities or shifting operations, and monitoring indicators related both to productivity (machine occupancy, lead times, utilisation) and to human factors (distribution of manual tasks, critical interventions, ergonomically unfavourable situations, perceived strain, etc.). The internship is part of the OPTIMAN project conducted in collaboration with Maugars Industrie, which focuses on the optimisation and digitalisation of a robotic machining cell in an Industry 5.0 perspective. Within this context, the intern will build on an existing laboratory digital twin and will contribute to its integration with the scheduling tool and to the design of a first human-centred interface. Expected deliverables include: a connected and operational digital-twin/scheduler link, a set of representative test scenarios, a prototype of a human-centred interface, and a scientific report summarising the methods, experiments, and main insights for Industry 5.0 implementation. Research Work Industry 5.0 represents a strategic shift in production systems by combining advanced technologies-such as digital twins, collaborative robots and IoT-with a strong human-centred focus. Its ambition is to enhance the resilience of value chains, support environmental sustainability and improve operator well-being through intelligent and ergonomic work environments. Recent works highlight the need for open interoperability models and seamless integration between physical and virtual layers, relying on real-time communication, standardized data architectures and adaptive interfaces tailored to operators' needs (Gumzej & Rosi, 2023; Alexa et al., 2022; Partarakis & Zabulis, 2024). In parallel, research on collaborative robotics and digital twins shows that accurately modelling production cells makes it possible to simulate, monitor and remotely adjust complex industrial processes (Havard et al., 2021; Hémono et al 2024). When combined with human-aware planning approaches (e.g. fatigue-aware scheduling and break planning), these technologies contribute to reducing physical strain, improving safety and supporting more efficient decision-making on the shop floor (Chabane et al., 2023; Bouaziz, 2024; Hémono et al., 2025). In particular, the emergence of digital-twin-based control of robots offers a powerful way to manage smart systems interacting with human operators in increasingly uncertain industrial environments (Hémono et al., 2025). Within this context, the Optiman project, conducted in partnership with Atelier Maugars, aims to develop a digital twin for a robotic cell, coupled with an instrumented physical model. The objective is to supervise and control machining machines in real time while integrating the latest advancements in human-machine interaction (Partarakis, 2024). This innovative approach not only enhances the responsiveness and reliability of production but also reduces the cognitive and physical load on operators. The implemented systems, based on cyber-physical systems and enhanced connectivity, will make the workshop more agile by facilitating adaptation to demand fluctuations and operational uncertainties. Ultimately, this project fully embodies the vision of Industry 5.0: combining industrial performance with consideration of human and environmental dimensions to foster resilience and sustainability. This internship aims to design and develop the digital counterpart of an existing instrumented robotic model and to connect both parts in order to simulate, control, and test various human-machine interaction and communication scenarios. The physical cell has already been built and can be controlled from the laboratory; the core objective of the internship is therefore to develop the digital twin and ensure its real-time interaction with the physical system. The expected outcomes include: Enhancing real-time supervision through a dynamic 3D digital representation of the cell. Validating innovative control and optimization algorithms for robotic cells using the digital twin as a safe testbed. Personalizing the user experience to improve operator efficiency and reduce workload strain. Internship Phases: Understanding the existing physical system (laboratory cell) and the objectives of the Optiman project. Conducting a state-of-the-art review on digital twin technologies, communication architectures, and human-machine interaction in robotic cells. Specifying the requirements and architecture of the digital twin (data model, 3D representation, communication interfaces). Developing the digital model of the robotic cell and its interactive 3D visualization. Implementing and testing the communication layer between the physical model and its digital twin (data exchange, synchronization,…

CESI est une école d'ingénieurs qui fait de la promotion sociale par l'excellence un modèle de réussite. Rejoignez un environnement stimulant où l'esprit d'équipe, la diversité des projets et l'autonomie ne font qu'un. Découvrez une école qui a su développer un modèle unique et se donne les moyens au quotidien de relever les grands défis de l'époque. Nos 25 campus, 28 000 étudiants, 8000 entreprises partenaires et 106 000 alumni témoignent de l'impact de CESI au niveau national. CESI accompagne ses étudiants en utilisant des méthodes innovantes de pédagogie active. L'établissement forme avec rigueur les futurs ingénieurs, techniciens et managers, dans les secteurs suivants : l'Industrie & l'Innovation, le BTP, l'Informatique et le Numérique et le Développement Durable. Parallèlement, CESI concrétise son engagement dans la Recherche à travers des activités menées au sein de son Laboratoire d'Innovation Numérique, CESI LINEACT. Les partenariats établis avec 130 universités à travers le globe, attestent de l'engagement international de CESI. Ces liens privilégiés offrent aux élèves ingénieurs une mobilité sortante et entrante à l'échelle internationale, façonnée notamment par des stages obligatoires faisant partie intégrante de leur cursus.

offers.title: Airbus UpNext Internship 2026 - Functional Automatic tests industrialization developer (m/f)
offers.description_raw: **Job Description:** The Airbus UpNext Optimate demonstrator will pave the way to smart automation capabilities by integration of new innovative bricks including computer vision and data fusion. The goal is to help the pilots and facilitate the mission. * We are looking for un intern ASAP to be a part of our team and to deal with Automatic tests industrialization topics. The end of the intership is end of September 2026 ( the deadline of the demo) * * Mission * You will be involved in the entire testing lifecycle, from design to automation, with a focus on API and HMI testing. Your main tasks and responsibilities will include: * Industrialised the automatisation test prototype already developed * Support the team on designing and executing the new features tests plans, and updates current automated test plans * Test and manipulate APIs to ensure their proper functioning (Postman) * Update test scenarios in Gherkin according to bugs fixing, changes and new features * Update automate tests inside existing tests platforms * Collaborate with development teams to identify and resolve anomalies * Collaborate with the V&V team, and the functions owners * Track anomalies and suggest improvements * Support the knowledge management owners in order to build the accurate documentation for testing transfer knowledge You are passionate about aeronautics, motivated by the challenge and ready to constantly learn and to develop yourself and the others, this project could be yours too. * Your boarding pass * What you bring: * Studies in Computer Science * Background in one or more of the following fields: Postman, Gherkin * Programming skills in Java Script, Playwright, ... * Negotiation level in English is required * Passionate about exploring new areas * Able to self-manage and yet a team-player! * You are impatient with a burning desire to execute rapidly, without compromising neither safety nor ethics nor compliance. * You have and share the values of transparency, courage, humility, empathy and care for others. * You are a hands-on person, solution oriented and communicative. * You are willing to have fun ;) What you get: * Participate to the Autonomy aviation revolution * An environment that not only fosters your development in many ways, but also rewards it with plenty of room to grow * A shared open space office with highly skilled multicultural teams * UpNext communities bonding events * A high-achieving, experienced and fun team *About us:* Founded in 2017, Airbus UpNext focuses on flying future technologies at speeds well beyond what seems feasible today. In doing so, it is actively shaping the future of the aerospace industry. Designed as a talent incubator, Airbus UpNext is a place where you can act and think like a startup while building on the strong expertise of Airbus, a place where you are empowered to test & challenge new processes and ways of working. Airbus UpNext's demonstrators evaluate, mature and validate potential new products and services that encompass radical technological breakthroughs. It has three flagships locations in France, Germany and Spain, to rapidly develop and test future technologies in scaled applications. Our mission is: * To identify the trends that could disrupt the future of the aerospace industry and evaluate them to demonstrate their potential as a viable product. * To accelerate traditional research cycles and prototype development to achieve proof of concept in a real environment and at a convincing scale and speed. * To develop real-world applications for emerging aerospace technologies, thereby driving their maturity and increasing their value. * To be THE reference for Technology Value Assessment Our Values: #Keep it Simple #Be Audacious #Exploring Together Our DNA: #Speed of Execution, #Caring for Each Other, #Open to the World This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth. ****Company:**** Airbus ExO Autonomy SAS *Employment Type:* Internship ------- *Experience Level:* Student *Job Family:* Testing By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus. Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to *** . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

offers.title: Internship VLF4EU : Interface and control of an educational device in extended reality through its digital twin
offers.description_raw:
Laboratory presentation CESI LINEACT (UR 7527), Laboratory for Digital Innovation for Businesses and Learning to Support the Competitiveness of Territories, anticipates and accompanies the technological mutations of sectors and services related to industry and construction. The historical proximity of CESI to companies is a determining factor in our research activities. It has led us to focus our efforts on applied research close to companies and in partnership with them. A human-centered approach coupled with the use of technologies, as well as territorial networking and links with training, has enabled the construction of cross-cutting research; it puts humans, their needs, and their uses at the center of its issues and addresses the technological angle through these contributions. Its research is organized according to two interdisciplinary scientific teams and several application areas. Team 1 'Learning and Innovating' mainly concerns Cognitive Sciences, Social Sciences, and Management Sciences, Training Techniques, and those of Innovation. The main scientific objectives are the understanding of the effects of the environment, and, more particularly, of situations instrumented by technical objects (platforms, prototyping workshops, immersive systems...) on learning, creativity, and innovation processes. Team 2 'Engineering and Digital Tools' mainly concerns Digital Sciences and Engineering. The main scientific objectives focus on modeling, simulation, optimization, and data analysis of cyber-physical systems. Research also focuses on decision-support tools and on the study of human-system interactions, particularly through digital twins coupled with virtual or augmented environments. These two teams develop and cross their research in application areas such as Industry 5.0, Construction 4.0 and Sustainable City, Digital Services. Areas supported by research platforms, mainly the one in Rouen dedicated to Factory 5.0 and the one in Nanterre dedicated to Factory 5.0 and Construction 4.0. Abstract The study explores the development and utilization of digital twins and extended reality tools to enhance remote maintenance procedures, focusing on creating a functional digital twin and developing an interface for device control in extended reality.Keywords : Extended Reality, Digital twin The technological advancements of Industry 4.0 and the human-centric approaches of Industry 5.0 have paved the way for the implementation of new methodologies and technologies, including digital twins (DT) and extended reality (XR) tools. However, the increasing complexity of installations, combined with the need for external expertise during maintenance operations, calls for a rethinking of remote assistance methods. To address these challenges, our work focuses on utilizing these technologies to improve maintenance procedures. As part of this internship, several stages of this process will be studied. Initially, it will be necessary to create a digital twin of one of our devices used in training, based on the already developed 3D model. To make it functional, the physical model will need to be formalized and the mathematical model integrated into the digital twin. Finally, the development of the interface and control of the device in extended reality will constitute the final stage of this work. Research Work The fourth industrial revolution, or Industry 4.0 (I4.0), emerged in 2011, focusing on the digitalization and automation of industrial processes to improve the quality and reliability of systems. In this context, one of the most costly processes in industry is maintenance. I4.0 has enabled the development of new maintenance strategies, such as predictive maintenance, which anticipates failures based on data collected by sensors, and prescriptive maintenance, which suggests corrective actions based on this data. These strategies help reduce maintenance costs and generate substantial savings. However, the growing complexity of industrial equipment requires easy access to information for operators. Remote assistance has become essential, especially in situations where it is difficult or costly to relocate experts. In the context of Industry 5.0 (Guo et al., 2024; Maddikunta et al., 2022), human-centric approach integrating Extended reality (XR) technologies, such as augmented reality (AR) and mixed reality (MR), offer solutions to enhance remote collaboration, allowing an on-site operator to interact with an expert without the need for physical relocation. The study focuses on the use of virtual reality (VR) and mixed reality (MR) to facilitate inspections and maintenance activities of industrial equipment and associated training phases. By using digital twins (DT) interfaced in XR (XR DT) based on digital models of equipment, these technologies allow experts to guide operators remotely (Coupry et al., 2023), while providing a virtual environment that enables real-time interaction. The goal is to ensure effective collaboration and guarantee the interoperability of tools between the expert and the operator, regardless of their location. Subject As part of the JENII project, the CESI LINEACT laboratory is developing INTERVALES (Richard et al., 2021) and LINEACT UA (Havard et al., 2023) frameworks to design XR DT, guides for effective pedagogical scenarios, feedback, and concrete examples of digital twins of industrial systems. The latest work proposes a workflow for creating an OPCUA server, integrating tools such as Unity, asyncua, and Docker. It introduces an architecture where physical objects (robots, production lines) can be simulated or connected via OPCUA servers, enabling remote interaction through immersive applications. These tools have been deployed in the engineering program at CESI school as part of a project to automate a manual gluing workstation on a production line. Learners are tasked with transforming this workstation using a 3D printer converted into a gluing machine and integrating it into the production line. The production line has already been studied, as a digital twin has previously been created. Based on these results and in the context of the VLF4EU (Virtual Learning Factory Networking and Strategy Build Up: Supporting EUropean Industrial Digitisation Competitiveness and Growth for All) project, the goal of this project is to build on the work already completed to create a digital twin of the gluing machine, integrate it with the existing tools, and ultimately develop a mixed reality interface to control the gluing machine in real time through its digital twin.

It has led us to focus our efforts on applied research close to companies and in partnership with them. A human-centered approach coupled with the use of technologies, as well as territorial networking and links with training, has enabled the construction of cross-cutting research; it puts humans, their needs, and their uses at the center of its issues and addresses the technological angle through these contributions. Its research is organized according to two interdisciplinary scientific teams and several application areas. Team 1 'Learning and Innovating' mainly concerns Cognitive Sciences, Social Sciences, and Management Sciences, Training Techniques, and those of Innovation. The main scientific objectives are the understanding of the effects of the environment, and, more particularly, of situations instrumented by technical objects (platforms, prototyping workshops, immersive systems...) on learning, creativity, and innovation processes. Team 2 'Engineering and Digital Tools' mainly concerns Digital Sciences and Engineering. The main scientific objectives focus on modeling, simulation, optimization, and data analysis of cyber-physical systems. Research also focuses on decision-support tools and on the study of human-system interactions, particularly through digital twins coupled with virtual or augmented environments. These two teams develop and cross their research in application areas such as Industry 5.0, Construction 4.0 and Sustainable City, Digital Services. Areas supported by research platforms, mainly the one in Rouen dedicated to Factory 5.0 and the one in Nanterre dedicated to Factory 5.0 and Construction 4.0. Abstract The study explores the development and utilization of digital twins and extended reality tools to enhance remote maintenance procedures, focusing on creating a functional digital twin and developing an interface for device control in extended reality.Keywords : Extended Reality, Digital twin The technological advancements of Industry 4.0 and the human-centric approaches of Industry 5.0 have paved the way for the implementation of new methodologies and technologies, including digital twins (DT) and extended reality (XR) tools. However, the increasing complexity of installations, combined with the need for external expertise during maintenance operations, calls for a rethinking of remote assistance methods. To address these challenges, our work focuses on utilizing these technologies to improve maintenance procedures. As part of this internship, several stages of this process will be studied. Initially, it will be necessary to create a digital twin of one of our devices used in training, based on the already developed 3D model. To make it functional, the physical model will need to be formalized and the mathematical model integrated into the digital twin. Finally, the development of the interface and control of the device in extended reality will constitute the final stage of this work. Research Work The fourth industrial revolution, or Industry 4.0 (I4.0), emerged in 2011, focusing on the digitalization and automation of industrial processes to improve the quality and reliability of systems. In this context, one of the most costly processes in industry is maintenance. I4.0 has enabled the development of new maintenance strategies, such as predictive maintenance, which anticipates failures based on data collected by sensors, and prescriptive maintenance, which suggests corrective actions based on this data. These strategies help reduce maintenance costs and generate substantial savings. However, the growing complexity of industrial equipment requires easy access to information for operators. Remote assistance has become essential, especially in situations where it is difficult or costly to relocate experts. In the context of Industry 5.0 (Guo et al., 2024; Maddikunta et al., 2022), human-centric approach integrating Extended reality (XR) technologies, such as augmented reality (AR) and mixed reality (MR), offer solutions to enhance remote collaboration, allowing an on-site operator to interact with an expert without the need for physical relocation. The study focuses on the use of virtual reality (VR) and mixed reality (MR) to facilitate inspections and maintenance activities of industrial equipment and associated training phases. By using digital twins (DT) interfaced in XR (XR DT) based on digital models of equipment, these technologies allow experts to guide operators remotely (Coupry et al., 2023), while providing a virtual environment that enables real-time interaction. The goal is to ensure effective collaboration and guarantee the interoperability of tools between the expert and the operator, regardless of their location. Subject As part of the JENII project, the CESI LINEACT laboratory is developing INTERVALES (Richard et al., 2021) and LINEACT UA (Havard et al., 2023) frameworks to design XR DT, guides for effective pedagogical scenarios, feedback, and concrete examples of digital twins of industrial systems. The latest work proposes a workflow for creating an OPCUA server, integrating tools such as Unity, asyncua, and Docker. It introduces an architecture where physical objects (robots, production lines) can be simulated or connected via OPCUA servers, enabling remote interaction through immersive applications. These tools have been deployed in the engineering program at CESI school as part of a project to automate a manual gluing workstation on a production line. Learners are tasked with transforming this workstation using a 3D printer converted into a gluing machine and integrating it into the production line. The production line has already been studied, as a digital twin has previously been created. Based on these results and in the context of the VLF4EU (Virtual Learning Factory Networking and Strategy Build Up: Supporting EUropean Industrial Digitisation Competitiveness and Growth for All) project, the goal of this project is to build on the work already completed to create a digital twin of the gluing machine, integrate it with the existing tools, and ultimately develop a mixed reality interface to control the gluing machine in real time through its digital twin.

offers.title: Mission bénévole non rémunérée : Data Engineer Mobile – Instrumentation & attribution - à distance
offers.description_raw:
Mission proposée par Eiko Informations complémentaires Objectif : Remonter les événements clés de l'app (parcours, activités, complétions), suivre les téléchargements et relier l'acquisition (UTM/campagnes) à l'usage.MissionsÉtat des lieux de l'app : stack (iOS/Android, cross-platform), analytics existant ou non.Proposer et implémenter une solution d'instrumentation : typiquement Firebase Analytics (souvent le plus simple), ou autre selon contraintes.Définir la liste d'événements app : onboarding, start parcours, activité réalisée, fin parcours, NPS/feedback, etc.Mettre en place le suivi des installations / téléchargements et sources d'acquisition.Organiser la cohérence entre web UTM → store → app (dans la limite possible des plateformes).Livrables attendusPlan d'événements app (dictionnaire : nom, paramètres, déclencheur)Instrumentation en place + tests (debug view)Tableau de bord minimal : installs, activation, rétention, usageDocumentation dev : "comment ajouter un nouvel event"

Compétences et savoir-être Dév mobile iOS/Android (ou Flutter/React Native) + analytics (Firebase/GA4)Capacité à travailler "privacy by design" (minimisation, pertinence) Disponibilité demandée 1 à 2 mois (3-6 h/semaine)

Tous Bénévoles est une association caritative qui publie des offres de bénévolat dans tous types d'activité. Les postes proposés sont des missions bénévoles et ne sont donc pas rémunérés.
